GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Kingdoms and Empires take themselves too seriously.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of divine comedies and tragedies played to arenas filled to capacity. And also...Ugh being impaled with a sword sure can be hazardous to your health. Ha ha... Ahem well for %d gildar, your troops would at least enjoy a good laugh every once in a while.
UnitType.Backstory: Everyone keeps telling Bernie that his old fake-sword-in-the-chest prank is stale but do you think he listens? His gaudy clothes are an embarrassment and many of his acquaintances usually avoid him in public. And yet behind this buffoonish facade lies a brilliant hero in the making.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I present myself before you to grant you the benefit of my vast experience. I will let you dig through the gold mine that is my mind.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of letting others profit from my considerable experience. Young people need tutoring in these troubled times and elders have a duty to offer guidance. Let's not quibble on the matter of wages: %d gildar will be enough.
UnitType.Backstory: Bevarras Erodell is an insufferable know-it-all who will steer any conversation on any given subject back to his personal experiences. He simply cannot resist sharing his vast repertoire of anecdotes. The latter is so immense that some suspect he's inventing stories as he goes along. Despite these annoying quirks, there's no arguing against his intelligence and the pearls of wisdom he dispenses on a regular basis.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Don't tell me I'm too young to fight. I'm a true soldier and I'll prove it!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of joining the war and being useful. I can't stay behind, I just can't. I want to help anyway I can. I'm very agile and I can light candles with my fingertips. I handle spears well. I'm fit! You've got to give me a chance! Please, please, please! Take me away from the streets and I will not disappoint you. I would only ask for the meager wages of a solider (%d gildar).
UnitType.Backstory: Brattie is a young tough who believes she has outlived ruling the gutters and bullying street urchins. Her best friend Tarvi left for war several weeks ago and she longs to join her on the glory road to adventure. Having suffered rejection from the military recruiters for being "still a child", she has attempted several times to sneak through the backdoor. She claims the future of Elemental is also her concern and who's to say she can't fight for her country in its time of need?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Focused and driven, that is my motto.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of adventuring - yeah I know kind of generic - but I'm focused and driven, did I already say that? Anyway I would gladly join you for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: In a short time, Caldiam has been an innkeeper, a soldier, a farmer, a weapons instructor, a mercenary and probably a few other occupations he wouldn't care to reveal. He has set his mind on becoming an adventurer for hire, at least until the end of the week.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Feel the winds of the approaching storm? They herald the thundering charge of my fury.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of perpetual storms. The booming and shaking kind which topple towers and crumble castles. There's an affinity I can't explain but I only feel alive when storms are raging. I will soon control them and if you wish to hedge a bet on my future mastery, I will join your service for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Clarity Clearbrook has always been restless and unsatisfied and that ever since she was a toddler. She's only energized and happy during violent stormy weather, laughing and dancing in the pouring rain to the sound of the rumbling thunder. So intense are these moments that she secretly longs to launch herself in the eye of a hurricane and surrender herself to the chaos. Her permanent call to the clouds has given her an inner understanding of the forces at work and she knows she's on the verge of grasping the power to bend the elements under her control.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Come, we'll swim together against the raging currents until we reach the placid lakes of victory.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of being part of this wonderful adventure of yours. Helping you build your kingdom, being there when new settlements will be founded, exploring spooky places and discovering treasures, becoming part of legend... Golly! Please accept my collaboration and I would only ask %d gildar for wages, a very small sum.
UnitType.Backstory: Deezra Salvon is a very young woman full of energy, bursting with enthusiasm at the idea of building a kingdom from scratch, treasure hunting and questing. She's probably in for a wake-up call when her romanticized notions of adventure will crash against the harsh realities of war. And yet she's a wonderful companion, her joy and innocence are refreshing, her optimism is boundless and her constant laughter very catching.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I seem to have misplaced my pretty silver purse. It has great sentimental value. Oh won't you please help me find it?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of well... finding my silver purse. I apologize but I am unable to answer philosophical questions at this instant, the loss of that purse is simply maddening. A gift from Harvey! Please help me out a bit and I could in return entertain you during downtime. You see I'm a trained lady's companion (the funds required to search for the purse will cost %d gildar).
UnitType.Backstory: A lady companion to Duchess Ydette, Edna foolishly tried to retrace the steps of their last stroll through the woods when she realized she had lost her silver purse. It wasn't the loss of the few gildar coins inside that mattered, she was devastated because the purse was a parting gift from her sweetheart Harvey who enrolled in the army several months ago. During her search, she came face to face with a huge hungry bear. Fleeing, her legs tangling in her dress, she managed somehow to outdistance her ursine pursuer which seemed to be moving in slow motion. Unbeknownst to Edna, the sudden stress triggered her dormant magical powers which she unconsciously used on the bear. Now completely lost, she has no clue how to find her way back to the Duchess' castle. And there still remains the matter of that purse. Can you possibly help her out?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Enough palaver! I'm the only possible choice if you intend to win this race.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of glamor and greatness of course, who doesn't? And being rich too... Not distinguished enough? Not all of us aspire to elevate the human condition you know... Well if you want to hire me and my unique fighting skills if will cost you %d gildar. Yes that much!
UnitType.Backstory: The word on the street is to stay away from Eldorath, that he is turncoat with a silver tongue, that he's always rolling with the strongest current. Qualifying screams usually follow him around such as "hustler!", "traitor!", "conman!" and "thief!". He will dismiss such recriminations with incredible effrontery, even in the face of overwhelming proof and respond that weaklings and patsies are fair prey in these difficult times. Could it be that he's actually a semi-honest liar?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Freedom... At last.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of freedom and well... nothing else. Please give me %d gildar and I'm yours to command... I mean I would join your forces as an equal partner.
UnitType.Backstory: Flick is a former slave who has managed somehow to escape his Quendar masters. He's broken and frail but freedom just might put some colors back into his cheeks. The troops are quite fond of him and frequently join in when he starts singing the songs of slaves, effectively raising morale and reinforcing camaraderie.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Healing is my lifelong duty.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of aiding the poor and healing the sick. For a modest contribution of %d gildar, my medications are yours.
UnitType.Backstory: Brother Garv has long roamed the countryside, going from one village to the next, giving comfort to the broken and dispirited.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Behold Elemental's most precious gem.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of always feeling as precious as a priceless jewel. If you want me to dazzle your troops, I would request the sum of %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Jade's parents played a bit too much with magical energies, going far beyond the safety limits of experimentation. Unbeknownst to them, their genes were altered by the reckless exposure and years later, they gave birth to a green-skinned daughter. Far from being horrified, they were immensely proud of their best "magical experiment" and gave her the name "Jade" for the beautiful shade and sheen of her skin. Now a beautiful woman, Jade can attest that it's not that hard being green.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Err... Well maybe I thought I could be useful and... Maybe lend a hand here and there... Please let me know.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of... hmmm... Are you sure you're interested in me? I... I guess we could... If you want that is... work together? It's difficult for me to speak about these things but... Would %d gildar be acceptable?
UnitType.Backstory: Fact: Junnie is as shy as a startled deer and interacting with others always translates in harrowing struggles against her crippling inner restraints. However, once in the heat of action, she's a capable fighter who takes gutsy initiatives, hurling herself headfirst into enemy lines. Finally letting loose.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Welcome, Welcome! Special rebates just for you and your troops! There will always be something to fill your heart's content inside my shop!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of free trade and the second coming of the merchant era. Surely after all this warring nonsense is over we can start sending our caravans to the four corners of Elemental again? While you're here, take a look at my wares! You'll find no better quality anywhere else. This one? Since I like you a great deal, I'll sell it to you without a profit for %d gildar!
UnitType.Backstory: Lignatius is something of the archetypal merchant: his soul belongs to the gods of commerce and the all mighty gildar drives his every thought. Obsequious to the point of being nauseating, Lignatius is in reality a negotiating shark hiding behind the harmless facade of a benevolent and gentle trader. Persistent rumors whisper he's even a member of the elusive Black Market Bazaar trading society. A brilliant smooth talker, he will convince his buyers that he's practically giving goods away and that they are making the deals of a lifetime, transactions which severely encroach his profit margins and put his solvency at great risk. Pure hogwash of course as Lignatius would never sell anything without making a twenty five percent benefit. If you happen to mention it, he will act wounded and throw in an extra free (and often useless) item to sweeten the deal. Just think what this character could accomplish if he were to negotiate trade treaties on your behalf and insert clauses of his own design. It is well known that behind every good diplomat lies a great merchant.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'A solid heart with an unquenchable thirst for action.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of striking back at those bastard Empires and removing them from the face of Elemental. Yes it's time for some payback. I'll gladly fight under your banner for %d gildar, provided you act and don't sit around doing nothing.
UnitType.Backstory: Knowing there would be no peace with the surrounding Empire settlements, Lockheart Jariden was most vocal in demanding immediate action. Arrested by the local militia for fomenting unrest, Lockheart was given the choice between banishment or rotting in jail. Exile forced upon him, he tried one last time to convince the townsfolk but to no avail. Two days after his departure, he was devastated when refugees told him his settlement had been overrun by bloodthirsty Trog warriors.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I'm a bit lost right now, I don't know what to do.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of... finding my place in this big wide world. If you need an apprentice, I'd gladly join you for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Lorrin was separated from his delegation when he took a wrong turn after leaving the seminary. He missed his return ship and was devastated when he found out his fellow scholars had abandoned him. The next crossing is months away so what to do in the meantime?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Efficiency is never a casualty of my expeditious efforts.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of always moving on to the next task. We'll have all the necessary time to rest when our lifelines get the final cut. So tell me what needs to be done and I'll get it done immediately. This one-man workforce would only require %d gildar, the bargain of bargains!
UnitType.Backstory: Lyestar is restless individual who will rush through any given task in record time and systematically be the first to finish. If it's a compulsion, he's not aware of it on a conscious level and will always react with wounded innocence when accused of being competitive. He's just getting the job done and if others can't follow his rhythm, well maybe they should push themselves out of their comfort zones once in a while. What a bunch of slackers!

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'So what if I've got caked dirt under my fingernails? I won't be going to the grand Amarian Ball anytime soon.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of thriving, growing and flowering just like my beautiful plants. I'd skip the wilting part of course. Yes, yes, I would tend your gardens, stock your apothecaries, replant your forests and so much more only for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Maddy Muddyhands has such a knack with plants that she has become a local expert in many derivative trades without breaking much of a sweat: herbalist, fruitmonger, apothecary, gardener, florist, she's even an accomplished basketweaver. Her magnificently tended gardens always yield bountiful harvests and she has won many prizes at county fairs for the quality of her produce. Of course, she cheats by using Earth magic, something she has failed to mention repeatedly as she beams under accolades and compliments. Fully aware that it would only be a matter of time before someone exposed her, Maddy unexpectedly announced to the village council that she would travel for a bit in order to discover new flora and expand her knowledge, which she would then share to everyone's benefit. Could you find a more kind and selfless soul?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The desert is my father and I have his fiery temper. The desert is my mother and I have her cold disposition.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of loneliness and seclusion among the desert sands. But I cannot remain complacent when the future of Elemental is being played right before my eyes. Yes the conflagrations have been heard even in the far reaches of the Wastelands. This folly must stop and I will aid you for the small payment of %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: A child of endless desertic wastelands where eyes are burned by the unfiltered light, Mahmud was raised by the uncompromising sun, the deadly dust storms and the freezing lonely nights. His body in complete synch with these extreme variations, he can easily resist snake bites and scorpion stings. He has learned to draw water where it would have been impossible to find for the layman, triggering over time his latent magical gifts. Now one of the legendary Water Sorcerers of the Wastelands, Mahmud has become something of an iconic life-giving figure among the desert nomads.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Release me... (Yes we all say it).'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: (translated from grunts and gargles with phlegm projections) I thirst for a life. I need to pass this undead curse to the next victim... My dagger is sharp and I would plunge it into some soft skin... (points at your gildar pouch and screeches) %d gildar!!
UnitType.Backstory: Malveus doesn't remember anything about his past since he's been turned into a Butcherman, cursed to wander eternally as an undead wretch. And yet, there is a stirring within, a will to fulfill some potential which keeps bubbling to the surface of his simple thoughts.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The game of life is a difficult one to master indeed. I can help you start over as many times as necessary.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of traveling far and wide and meet thousands of different people. Bring happiness wherever the roads will send me. Yes I roam the lands and believe me, I have quite a few stories to share. We could travel together some bit and if you would cover my expenses of %d gildar, I will heal your army on a daily basis.
UnitType.Backstory: Massilda Milktop is an itinerant hedge witch who's always welcomed with open arms in any settlement she travels through. She will heal small wounds and speed recovery for serious injuries. She will also comfort minds and hearts with her stories of faraway countries, usually surrounded by a rapt audience in the village square. Don't ask her any personal questions however, she will brush them off lightly at first and then clam up completely under heavier scrutiny. Is she one of those broken healers, capable of giving relief to others but unable to repair her own broken parts?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Traveling is the soul's backbone.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of insuring the survival of the nomadic tribes' culture and way of life. For %d gildar, we could travel together and join forces for a little while.
UnitType.Backstory: Nadweena is an adventurer by breed and by choice, with the thrill of discovery always in her heart. Her nomadic lifestyle is always pushing her to seek out new horizons and new opportunities.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Taking care of the land and its inhabitants.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of attunement with the land and its living children. I'm hardworking and for %d gildar, my loyalty is yours.
UnitType.Backstory: Pete was content to tend his farm and was dubious of his friend John's dreams of a Peasant Kingdom. Wars ravaging the land would eventually turn him to more dangerous pursuits.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'To earn back what is rightfully mine.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of proving my worth as a warrior, leader and... heir. For no less than %d gildar, I would strengthen your armies with my expertise.
UnitType.Backstory: Pierham Sathor has been raised believing the throne of Men should have been his. Sour grapes and disagreements might explain a certain wanderlust on his part.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'What did you say? Yeah right. Just don't start messing around with me.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of putting people back in their place. You may pay me %d gildar right now.
UnitType.Backstory: Shezyll is a spoiled young noble who's run away yet again after a silly row with her parents. Maybe she doesn't mean to come back to her father's estate this time?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Hunter for hire, bow at the ready.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of great marksmanship. My bow and arrows are always at the ready. My perfect aim would only cost you %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Storen left his group of Hunters in order to distinguish himself, feeling he should aspire to become more than an anonymous grunt. Him aim is perfectible but he's a fast learner.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Intelligent money for better city management.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of finesse and competence in city management, which means I would sell my talents for no less than %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Studies and research make Suradrine's entire background, her formative years spent in books and dusty scrolls. She's very intelligent and has no qualms about stating it openly, perfectly aware that she'll be the shining jewel of her future employer's administration.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Maybe time will sprinkle the dust of forgetfulness upon that which my unforgiving heart cannot accept.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of succeeding with this fresh start of mine. My past is malignant, drenched in hatred and incomprehension. I've had enough and I need to put it all behind. Recruit me, I'm tough, able and willing and would only ask for %d gildar to work for you.
UnitType.Backstory: The Tallucks and the Mandibucks had been feuding for generations, with only a vague recollection of the nature of the original slight. Not even the Cataclysm was powerful enough to reunite the families under the peace banner. When the Mandibucks were overrun by starving brigands, they asked for the Tallucks' help. Thinking it was a trap, the latter remained put and the Mandibucks were massacred. Realizing their gross misjudgment, the Tallucks attacked the depleted bandits and slew them to the last one. Ashamed of his family's conduct, especially as they claimed the Mandibuck lands as their own, Nayton Talluck decided the time had come to remove himself from this poisonous scene and make a fresh start in a neighboring kingdom.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'They say I'm the life of the party, any party. I could also be the life of your kingdom.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of always attending the most fashionable parties. Don't let this frivolous exterior fool you, I am very much aware of the dramatic situation Elemental has fallen into. These are crucial times and for %d gildar, I would put my considerable influence on your side.
UnitType.Backstory: Tesha Jalaazu is a notorious socialite who can make parties by showing up or break them by refusing to endorse them with her attendance. A mysterious woman with considerable wealth, she is discreetly interviewing sovereigns during those lavish gatherings, looking for the one most likely to succeed and deserving her unconditional support. Her choice has finally been made it would seem.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Having Kulan's assassins on my trail does not make me a damsel in distress. Never forget that.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of... at this point, it's only about living until the next day, dodging Kulan's assassins. Maybe we can strike a deal together, I'll put my considerable magical talents at your service, my spell repertoire and ability to turn essence into mana in exchange for your loyalty and protection. My price is %d gildar, a mere token of faith.
UnitType.Backstory: As the last legitimate contender for the Urxen throne, Urxia has been mercilessly hunted down by Kulan's mercenaries, pursuing her even into the most secluded of Kingdom territories. Unlike her poor older brother and younger sister, she has miraculously managed to evade multiple attempts on her life, including distant magical attacks. These curses, while not fatal thanks to the protection provided by her magical ring, have left her permanently scarred. A strong woman with an indomitable will to survive, Princess Urxia has many magical talents and as a true sovereign in the making, can turn the essence of shards into mana.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'If accessorizing is first and foremost utilitarian, it's no excuse to forsake elegance and grace.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of fashion and catwalks, which means I would dazzle your troops and raise morale for no less than %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Hailing from a backwards village, Vondra dreams of opening her own tailor shop one day and crafting court dresses for noble ladies. Desperately seeking employment, she's willing to put herself in danger in order to raise a capital and turn her dreams into reality.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I strive for the betterment of manners amongst the champions. High society values are not optional considerations.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of social graces, which means I would educate your court for no less than %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Lady Yoretta loves her tea and crumpets but yearns to conquer new horizons too, with good manners. Prim and proper, she aims to educate and eradicate vulgarity.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Whenever I find something squishy I step on it. Humans are squishy so I step on them.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of endless gore but I wouldn't mind a modest contribution of %d gildar to go with the bloody bits.
UnitType.Backstory: After crushing my sisters due to a rather -let's be honest here- inane disagreement, I had a revelation: violence is great fun. I then decided to make a living out of it. Whether you believe it or not, that's my story.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The best assassin mage in the realm who excels at carving red smiles.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of plunging knives and carving red smiles. For my services, I demand %d gildar. Unless you'd rather turn your back?
UnitType.Backstory: A double fascination animates Androval: magical arts and assassins tools. To those that call him a backstabbing squid, he will only disagree with the squid part.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The hissing flames have so much to teach you and I can serve as their interpreter.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of going back to the simple existence I had among my Ignys pack. Well sometimes. I've been bitten by the civilization bug and I can't go back anymore. But I will never forget where I come from. I could join your nest for %d gildar and whisper to you the secret lore of the Fire Snakes.
UnitType.Backstory: Fourteen years ago, the venerable scholar Ghar'Daar was doing fieldwork, writing down the final observations for his treatise "The Ignys, their habitat and ecology". Sneaking upon a promising pack of Fire Snakes, he was amazed to find a Quendar child among them, slithering and hissing with the larger reptiles. Raised by the Ignys? Impossible and yet. Ghar'Daar organized a tumultuous rescue operation and brought the child kicking and screaming back to civilization. The scholar named him Bhak'Tem and raised him as his own son, not completely out of disinterest as his treatise more than doubled in volume. The child had great difficulties conceptualizing that these bipeds where his kin and learning to walk in lieu of slithering was a challenge not yet fully mastered on the eve of adulthood. Tired of all the finger pointing and being treated as a curiosity, Bhak'Tem left his ailing foster father for a life of adventuring, preferably one writhed in flames.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The commercial expansion will consolidate the territorial one.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of opening shops all over Elemental that would rival the commercial power of Capitar. Yes my ambitions are way up there and I know you could be the means to my mercantile expansion. If we partner up, I would give you a share of the profit. You'll have to advance %d gildar though.
UnitType.Backstory: A merchant to the very core, Brazda has traded goods with no discrimination to kingdoms and empires alike. Brazen and cocky, she's an aggressive seller and will arrange to sink down the competition if necessary. She's been known to sell portraits to the blind and swords to the armless with that silver tongue of hers.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'To ride the wind in the fields of red.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of riding in battle with the metallic taste of blood in my throat as I purge the land of the Kingdom infestations. If you'd pay me %d gildar, we could ride together.
UnitType.Backstory: Drakt is not just another Urxen bloodmonger, he also tends the land with great care, fertilizing it with the bodies of his enemies.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Would you trust the keys of the treasure chest to a thief? Of course you wouldn't. How about to a bandit?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of putting my monetary knowledge to good use and remove myself from the dead end of banditry. I'll help your Empire thrive financially with the few chosen investments I have to recommend. Don't let trust become an issue, what have you got to lose? Just lay down %d gildar and I'll double that sum for you in no time.
UnitType.Backstory: Dresco is a rascal to the core, a professional shoplifter, a greedy haggler who would swindle his own mother out of her last gildar. With such qualities you'd think he'd be a lost cause, fit only to prowl the countryside with a pack of rogues sniffing for the next victim to despoil. While that image really hits the mark, Dresco does have the unique ability to find profitable investments which often double his earnings in the long run. On a slow rainy day, a candle lit up in his head and he daydreamed about testing his financial savviness on a macro level, namely with the coffers of an empire. The things he could do! He'd earn a healthy profit to keep the trust going and take generous servings for himself on the side. All that remains is to sell himself out in spite of his disreputable past. How about it? Would you willingly let the wolf enter the sheep shed on the promise of increased revenue and favorable bottom lines? Would you?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Let me teach you the ancient stories so we can write new ones together.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of contributing to the cycle of eternal renewal. The times are ripe my friend, we can't sink any futher. Now we write our own legend. For %d gildar, I would accompany you on that defining journey.
UnitType.Backstory: Drooda Durath is a living encyclopedia of ancient lore. She will devour any written word, from dreadful ledgers to lyrical volumes of ancient histories. She strives to put her name in a prominent position so she can become part of History herself and live eternally through the ink of future narrators.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Future empress of the world at large.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of enriching experiences and personal growth. Sounds sappy? Well for once it's true. I really need the experience and I would consider joining your cause for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Edwina is the daughter of Old Edward, a well-respected Kraxis noble sporting the highest ambitions. Edwina has been sent on a journey of self-discovery and been told to come back only once she's battle-hardened and fit to rule... the world.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My magic-fearing clan rejected me. What does your tribe have to offer?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of finding more than rejection and injustice. I know these are rough times but surely acceptance can be found at the end of the bend? Yes I have some special endowments that could be useful to you and since I'm looking for a new "family"... In other words, yes I'll take the bait for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: When Eghook started to show signs of greater intelligence, the other youths of his clan teamed up and bullied him incessantly. When he accidentally hasted himself in order to avoid being pummeled and responded with a flurry of punches to knock down his assailant, he was revealed to be one of those dreaded and feared magic users. He was given a wide berth afterwards. When the women of the clan started to fawn collectively over Eghook, all hell broke loose. The youths were now asking for his blood and the village elders, knowing there would be no containing them, banished Eghook from the clan to preserve the peace. Expelled with nothing but the clothes on his back and a rusty spear to defend himself, Eghook valiantly strode towards the next chapter in his life, one of adventure and wide open spaces.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Magic is like a razor-sharp blade. It's not dangerous in itself, it's the wielders who are.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of eradicating the wild elements of magic. To turn the chaotic nature of manipulating these energies into a discipline with its unbreakable codes and regulations. For only %d gildar, I would put some order in your shrines and colleges.
UnitType.Backstory: After witnessing a fatal accident during her tutelage as an apprentice, Jozevine Arendi became a firm devotee of the "precautionary magic" school of thought. The inherently volatile nature of magic requires strict discipline and any experimentation must be regulated, approved and confined. She believes wild talents should be hunted down and if they refuse indoctrination, they ought to be executed.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My dancing takes direct inspiration from Elemental's tragic past. Will you be the one to galvanize me into celebrating its future?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of using my body as an instrument of storytelling and give voice to the founding stories of our land. I know you will be an endless source of inspiration and for %d gildar, I shall dance to the beat of your exploits.
UnitType.Backstory: A strange creature with an alluring figure, Kayella appears to be related to the Quendar though she will only offer smiles to those bold enough to ask. The intricate tattoos on her arms are guaranteed to entrance as she performs her reptilian dances, swaying to the music of minstrels and troubadours. In the middle of a performance, she will haste herself, swirling and spinning to incredible speeds, proceeding to the pinnacle of her show by turning her tattoos into fantastical shapes such as Dragons, Knights or Stalkers which she animates to recount Elemental's most beloved fables.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Cold blood for a hothead.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of shedding my skin in volcanic environments. For %d gildar, I will give the taste of ashes to your enemies.
UnitType.Backstory: Kha'Shaar's choice of leaving his beloved volcanic grounds and living as a champion for hire makes many wonder if a violent quarrel didn't occur with the village elders who have always despised him for his greenish complexion.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'It's always nice to have high and lofty expectations. As long as you don't demand others to live up to your impossible dreams.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of simply enjoying my newfound independence. The last years of my childhood were infernal and it's good to be my own woman. We could work together, two independent minds pooling their talents. I would ask for %d gildar to make it happen.
UnitType.Backstory: Despite graduating with honors, Klauzia never could satisfy her overbearing parents who entertained wild dreams of seeing their daughter as Oracle Ceresa's personal archmage. Disgusted with the constant nattering and the "you're such a disappointment" diatribes, Klauzia chose to affix "Etherworn" to her name during her graduating ceremony in retaliation. She then refused to send her application to enter the Gravewarden corps and almost killed her parents when she announced she would lead the life of an adventurer.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Behold the face of your future administration.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of ending this maddening pandemonium left by the Cataclysm. Enough with disorder and unrest. I'll clean the mess for %d gildar and you'll watch your Empire thrive.
UnitType.Backstory: Raised in the wake of the Cataclysm, in the constant turmoil of despair and surrender, Luviola couldn't stand the ambient chaos anymore. By the simple act of cleaning up her parents' hut, she took the first step to pull herself out of the quagmire. She pushed her younger siblings around and yelled at her parents until they all snapped out of their pessimistic slumber. She then knocked on her neighbor's door armed with her flimsy broom. Reconstruction had begun.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'In this mad chase for technological breakthroughs, those who would willingly blindside themselves with ethics are utter fools.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of turning my least stray ideas into concrete applications. I'm a scientist with considerable renown for one so young and yes, I would consider becoming your top researcher for the starting sum of %d gildar. Oh and by the way don't pay any attention to those feeble-minded haters that claim I use children in my experiments. I only use Darklings.
UnitType.Backstory: Magrethe Shavim, daughter of Losten and Dankira, comes from a very wealthy background. Gifted with high intelligence, she developed early on a passion for sciences and experimental magics. Given complete freedom by her trusting parents, Magrethe took her unbridled scholarly pursuits towards the unconventional and the avant-garde without any ethics to guide her. While she has achieved honorable results, she crossed the line several times, applying her theories to dramatic effects on live subjects: animals, Mites, Darklings and even -as the rumors keep spreading- children. While she has gained recognition in some circles of thought, she has become for the vast majority the strange and creepy lady across the street. The one who will try to lure children with sweets into visiting her dark laboratory from which there is no return.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'No roads are ever safe from the likes of me.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of robbing fat caravans and convoys and become rich enough to buy my own kingdom. And then? I'd probably arrest and execute all highwaymen. Ha! Anyway, my loyalty can be bought for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Moraff is a self-professed highwayman who dreams of pulling off the most daring coup of all: ambushing and ransoming traveling royalty. With the huge sum of gildar, he would retire from his life of crime and buy himself a noble title. For the time being however, he's still a daydreaming lowlife scrounging on meager pickings.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I'm the furious volcano that will reduce this land to cinder and ash.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of fire, fire and fire. Let's burn the world together! Let's spread the flames for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Natoo Firestarter is a young sorcerer full of strong and destructive magical energies who feels restraint and precaution are his antitheses.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Let's have a little debate about nihilism.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of sweeping magics, you know the kind which overwhelms those weakling men. Give me %d gildar and I'll start invoking the tides of mayhem right this instant.
UnitType.Backstory: Obavadabro is well versed in magical theory and arcane studies. Of course, he remains a Trog but his brutal nature is somewhat tempered by his intellectual one.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I have seen many wonders and horrors during my travels. I know they will pale in comparison to the ones we'll face together.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of finding my revelators, the ones who will illuminate and change the course of my personal path. Such is my quest in the dark. Let's travel a bit together, I have a feeling such a pairing will be mutually beneficial. Let's agree to %d gildar as wages and start our journey.
UnitType.Backstory: The Urxen known as Otatar is a wanderer, a philosopher of sorts on a quest of perpetual self-discovery. He holds the unshakable belief that several individuals scattered throughout Elemental have the answers he seeks and that he needs to meet them all in turn to see the full picture. An impossible task for sure as he has no idea who or where these 'revelators' are or even their precise number. Still, the unwavering search for these elusive beings goes on.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'To reenact the era of the Living Dead.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for an unlife of extinguishing the spark of life. For %d gildar in my old pouch, I would put my resilience and unflinching determination at your service (approximate translation from hisses and gargles).
UnitType.Backstory: Personally cursed by the Titans for his insolence, Putrus The Zombie still wanders the realms a thousand years later, hating all life and plotting to destroy it. By joining a bellicose sovereign, he seeks only the violence of battle and the ending of lives, including his own.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Beauty might be in the eye of the beholder but mine will certifiably bedazzle onlookers.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of finding the perfect time to use this spectacular gift that nature has chosen to bless me with. My skin color is so unique that I am automatically admired. Favors keep pouring in, floods of them. I don't think you imagine how many locked doors suddenly swing open for me... If you wish to have such uniqueness accompany you in your peregrinations, it will require %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Quamathea cannot go anywhere without the subject of her unusual skin color being broached. Being quite a cold fish, she will frequently cut short such inquiries about her "exotic beauty" with dry humor by responding that the blue comes from eating a special breed of azure lobsters. The way light reflects on her gleaming scales can be especially dazzling, inducing a temporary hypnotic effect to the insistent gazer.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Sing along now! Mad as a hatter and crazy as a loon. I'm ready to sever the head of that goon.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of... This is truly making me so angry I'd scream until your ears fall off!! But then... You'd be rather cute without'em. A nice egghead to crack. No disrespect, not mocking you. Ha ha ha!! Me myself and I are worth %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Shirona has an unstable personality and is often subject to extreme mood swings, from uncontrollable laughter to red rage. She can stare anybody down with that mad gleam in her eyes.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Insight to understand the heart of the target.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of striking down legendary preys with my arrows. My aim is true and my eye is sharp. If you can pay fair wages and give me an advance of %d gildar, we can strike a deal.
UnitType.Backstory: As a child, Silex stubbornly refused to attend her magical lessons, preferring to shoot at rats with her sling. As she gained in maturity, the rocks were replaced by arrows and the rats by Mites. She now seeks greater challenges and seizes any opportunity to shoot at some hapless target.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I'm rough, I'm tough, I'm buff enough.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of showing everyone that I have the most impressive musculature in all Elemental. I constantly work out you see. Check out those biceps! Wanna compare them with yours side by side? How about we arm wrestle? You know bras de fer... No? Yeah, yeah for %d gildar my perfect frame will crush your enemies.
UnitType.Backstory: Always prompt to exhibit his muscles, Thruul will redirect any straying conversation towards the size of his biceps, the perfect shape of his pecs and the hardness of his abs. He will pester and hassle any unfortunate soul -even children- to compare their musculature with his and issue arm wrestling challenges ad nauseam. He should be a worthwhile investment however, with returns only a few seasons of experience away, as he has the potential to become a true powerhouse. Gagging him now and then might be required for a little peace and quiet though.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Once you fully accept your life of crime and revelry, you will cast off those moralistic shackles in the blink of an eye.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of revelry and if I have to loot and plunder for it, all the better. You can pay me %d gildar up front if you want to be in on it.
UnitType.Backstory: A childhood friend of the infamous thief Fendrall The Curr, Torken obviously didn't end up with better ethics. Be careful with your valuables whenever he's around, they tend to disappear like Ice Elementals under a blazing hot sun.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'A ruffian who won't be pushed over.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of bullying weaklings. I will rough'em up for you for a mere %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Uglenn is a vicious brute who has decided to elevate himself by leaving his pack of Ruffian brothers in order to lead the life of an adventurer. Is the little mouse going to become a big rat?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I'm a king without a castle, a sovereign without a crown, a leader without followers. I come seeking asylum.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of perhaps correcting some of my past mistakes. If such a thing is possible. If Jonstone could see what I have become, he'd have a good laugh for sure. I was a sovereign once, just like you and I can bring extra mana to your empire's pool. Help me and let me help you for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: The former sovereign of Crooked Castle, King Varl, fourth of his name, paid a heavy price when he sacked his popular general Jonstone Sepharius, immediately after the latter had broken a two months long siege orchestrated by a coalition of Fallen tribes. That's when dire rumors started spreading that Varl had thrown huge banquets for his court during the siege while the starved commoners were reduced to hunting for rats in the streets. No one cared enough to verify the veracity of these wild tales and the inflamed crowds turned into rioting mobs. Three days of devastation later, even his personal guard refused to protect him and opened the palace gates to the angry population. Fleeing for his life, Varl escaped through the underground tunnels designed by his wise ancestors. Now railed the Pauper King, hounded by his people, he seeks asylum in the Empire territories in exchange for his burgeoning magical talents and his capacity to turn essence into mana.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Wherever a Rainmaker goes, swamps and bogs follow.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of commanding the elements of heaven, which means you may pour me a full glass of %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Veela discovered her mastery over air and water while still a very young whelp. Feeling constricted in her native and backward village, she decided the time had come to leave, especially as the requests for her powers to be used towards agricultural ends were becoming alarmingly frequent.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Somber thoughts without the shadow of a doubt.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of casting a veil of shadows upon the world. For %d gildar, I'll darken it all for you.
UnitType.Backstory: Originating from the Somber tribe, it is rumored Wareen Somber is the lover and confidante of many sovereigns. Truth or calumny? Hard to say as secrecy abounds in the shadowy alcoves where Wareen is most likely to be found.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Winds can erode mountains away to nothing when they decide to manifest their discontentment. Know that I am their voice in the flesh.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of opening myself up further to the Air Elements. I know we communicated when I dared to defy them -I've been something of a reckless youth- and they bestowed some of their powers upon me. Not to brag but there is a huge potential within me and for %d gildar, you would profit immensely to have me by your side as it develops.
UnitType.Backstory: Wenyil Bleakwind comes from the Northern Plains where the howling winds constantly screech their displeasure. A daredevil to the core, the young Trog ascended the highest peaks in order to challenge them and bellow his defiance. Fearlessness is fearlessness. Amused by this mortal's insolence, the whimsical aerial elements decided to reward him by imbuing him with a tiny fragment of their power, giving Wenyil the potential to become one of Elemental's greatest Air Masters.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'In the cellar of your mind lies the casket that once opened, will intoxicate this world and make it whirl to your macabre beat.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of drinking the sweetest and most expensive wines. I have a palate that demands quality if not quantity. And let me tell you, once you commune with the heady liquors, you are in for some incredible revelations. For %d gildar, I could whisper a few in your ears.
UnitType.Backstory: It's while sipping her second bottle of Lost Barrowhill wine that Zorba heard strange and insistent voices in her head. The whispers coaxed her to reach into the farthest recesses of her mind and unlock a few of the secrets within. She eventually came out of her alcoholic trance with a massive headache and a disciple's repertoire in Death magic. There were also some disturbing side-effects as she started spouting much nonsense, such as Elemental being round and revolving around the sun in an ever expanding universe. Evidently yet another drunk lost in her cups.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Please let me hitch a ride with you or I shall be dreadfully late for my wedding.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of blissful joy in the arms of my dear, dear Toffrey. Today is my wedding day! Oh please, please won't you just give me a ride to the chapel? It's only a few leagues away. (You know how this will end, best be prepared to hand over %d gildar for a wedding gift).
UnitType.Backstory: Atonya died on what should have been the most beautiful day of her life: her wedding day. Coquettish, she spent too much time fussing over the finishing touches of her apparel and missed her ride to the chapel located a few leagues away from her village. Mad with distress, she ran along the road trying to coax any cavalier or chariot to give her a ride. A dark buggy with strange red curtains responded to her urgent requests and blinded by relief, Atonya injudiciously boarded the Blood God's carriage. What should have been a day of blissful unity became one of horrific dismembering. Atonya's spirit, mad with grief and unable to accept such a cruel fate, could not move on in the afterlife. To this day, she still haunts crossroads and tortuous bends in the path, begging and pleading for a ride to the wedding chapel on the threat of being late to the ceremony.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Dont let my name scare you. Consider it as a testament to my skills and not my character.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of shedding this solider's skin and working towards more earthly goals. Alas, wars are upon us and a grunt has got to earn a living so... for %d gildar, my sharp spear will bore your enemies down.
UnitType.Backstory: Borras isn't called "The Impaler" because he's cruel or takes pleasure in gory pastimes. It's rather because he expertly manipulates polearms and javelins to the point where he can twirl them as easily as batons.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My humble beginnings will dissipate like morning mist in the sunny days of our valorous and heroic deeds.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of putting my unique looks to good use and gain immediate recognition wherever I may go. Yes I wish to leave a lasting impression on Elemental and not fade away like some anonymous peasant tending his fields. For %d gildar, we could rise to fame together, like true partners sharing the risks and the glory.
UnitType.Backstory: Brashton aka Greenbeard has such a thirst for glory that his misguided endeavors to rise to fame have so far yielded the exact opposite effects. It really didn't help out when he staged the rescue of a nobleman's daughter with a troop of actors in the market square. The latter immediately called it quits when the city guard intervened with their sharp halberds, exposing Brashton as a fraud. In lieu of glory, he got mockery along with a humiliating sentence to the jailhouse. Dearly wishing to make amends, the "legendary" Greenbeard now seeks to associate himself with a greater power and rise to fame honestly, by performing the dangerous feats of a genuine hero. The most important question still remains unanswered: is the green hair a bad dye job?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'No seed can prosper on barren ground. Your kingdom needs a gardener to lovingly nurture what has already been planted.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of molding earthen forces to better commune with them. I'll reshape this world for your cause and for only %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Brond has always had the hands of a gardener, dirty nails and calluses galore. He became known as "The Brown" when the ground started shifting to his commands. Some claim the ancient Earthen Spirits turned him into their ambassador on the mortal plane, using him as a vessel to further their unfathomable agenda.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'It only takes one step to come down from the stage and become another kind of player: one in the drama of reality.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of going back to the Traveling Show and being on stage again. To bring some joy in these distraught times. But that can't be for now, not until the Show can get back on its feet, or wheels rather. Anyway, yes I'm a real mage that can do real magic. I need the work and for %d gildar, I'll assist your troops on the battlefields.
UnitType.Backstory: Dastax was a member of the now defunct Elemental's Magnificent Traveling Show. He played the part of the acrobatic pyromage, wowing crowds with his fiery antics, until the Circus made the fatal error of entering Fuskurt's territory, a notorious bandit lord. After a short-lived battle, Fuskurt and his men stole the last season's earnings and destroyed everything that couldn't be easily sold on the black market. Bereft and now without a livelihood, the carnies had no choice but to disband. Being a true mage, Dastax knew he could find employment in the military, going from a profession of joy and laughter to one of blood and tears.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Do not hesitate to delegate. Let me manage your estate and the benefits will reciprocate.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of overcoming that horrible experience I had with Baron Vom Waldom and prove myself under ideal conditions. By ideal, I don't mean the easy route, quite the contrary, I mean making difficult decisions and hard reforms with trust from the upper hierarchy. I ask for someone capable of delegating their administrative powers and letting me take action. Sounds reasonable don't you think? For %d gildar, I'll remodel your entire kingdom's inner workings.
UnitType.Backstory: Duanlea Shaldot's most defining character trait is her tenacity. She's not a quitter by any means and the fact that she had to resign from her previous position as an administrator weighs heavily on her conscience. Yet what could she have done? Baron Vom Waldom stubbornly refused to delegate his authority and insisted upon supervising every single small detail. Reforming was not something he could conceptualize and nothing ever got done. With all of her initiatives overruled, with the underlings openly challenging her decisions, Duanlea threw in the washing rag and left the Vom Waldom estates in the midst of astonishment, incomprehension and then resentment, the Baron threatening to send messengers to all his neighbors and impede her chances of finding a new employer. What's to worry about? Baron Vom Waldom's incompetence is in direct correlation with his paltry influence. Every one knows he wouldn't recognize common sense if it hit him in the eye with the Scythe of the Void.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The poison of revenge is in my blood.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of revenge for the destruction of my village. For %d gildar, my relentlessness is at your service.
UnitType.Backstory: Ensthemon is the sole survivor of a violent Fallen attack on his peaceful village. With nothing left but his faithful hammer, he seeks a sovereign who will give him an ideal to strive for and maybe quench the darkness festering in his heart.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Circumstances forced this role upon me. I'm not an assassin by trade but by necessity.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of being an actor for change instead of passively waiting for better days which won't come. I've had to put up with inertia in the face of grave peril. I've had enough. I would love to accompany you on your quest for change, for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: No one lifted a finger when Toneel kept stealing from the winter storage, putting the entire village at risk. Until Ezveralda removed the problem permanently. No one said anything when a new lordling, Count Jaram, pronounced himself their sovereign and enforced crushing taxes. Jaram broke his promise of protection at the first opportunity, refusing to send troops when the village was attacked by Darklings. When he came back to collect a large percentage of the crops, Ezveralda paid him with several well-placed arrows. Tired of living with sheep waiting to be slaughtered, tired of the ingratitude, Ezveralda left her native village with the burden of having become an assassin.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I've already burned out several sovereigns. Can you take the heat of my collaboration?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of thrills, spills and chills and will willingly put myself in danger accordingly. For %d gildar, I will share the risks with you.
UnitType.Backstory: Gelinda's fiery temperament has been known to make her boil to destructive excesses. Her special brand of high maintenance requires voluminous amounts of fuel in order to avoid collateral damage.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Kings and vagabonds, I don't discriminate. I rob them all blind.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of amassing enough plunder to retire while still young and lithe so I can revel in sinful leisure. Want my help? Then you can start filling my hoard with %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Harles is a bandit who fell on hard times when his base of operations was destroyed by a diligent local governor. Gildarless, he seeks employment so he can start building his criminal organization back from scratch. With such an unsavory character around, it's best to keep an eye over one's shoulder.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I suffer no fools.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of maximum efficiency. If you want your kingdom to run smoothly, you'd best hire me. You'd never have to worry about the home front again. I'll ask for an early advance on my wages: %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Imaris Trevellian took control of her parents' castle's daily affairs at the young age of fourteen, issuing orders to cooks, servants and guards. After sending the chamberlain into an early retirement, she pushed the treasurer aside and took over finances as well. A natural leader, she will take control of any situation, bruising many egos along the way.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I will stand my ground and provide shelter through the upcoming tempests of war.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of good food, tasty wines and fresh air. For %d gildar, I'd put my health and sturdiness at your service.
UnitType.Backstory: Imelda is a strong Ironeer woman who's been known to wrestle bigger men to exhaustion. If you really need to voice a disagreement to Imelda, it had better be worth the trouble.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'As a healer of the wilds, I will seek out suffering before it finds me.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of easing sufferings with my meager talents. I see some wounds that need tending. I would only ask for %d gildar to serve as your army's healer.
UnitType.Backstory: Juruba is a wandering healer who willingly enters warzones in order to lend any help she can. She is modest to a fault and accepts thanks and praise with great difficulty.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'If the meek are the ones to inherit, Elemental will never emerge out of the chaos.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of appeasing my dark moods. I had great difficulties accepting that my weaker brother was going to be the one to play the sovereign while I was expected to obey his amateurish edicts. Tired of being treated like a wanton child, I decided to forgo this life of frustration and leave it all behind. Yes, well you're not here to listen to my problems. I can wield a sword you know and for %d gildar, I'd gladly cut your enemies to pieces.
UnitType.Backstory: Karald Vandizer is yet another problematic second son who had the hardest time accepting that his older brother Kavi inherited the family estates and title. Growing tired of Karald's constant backtalking and seditious rants, Kavi decided to send him on the other side of Elemental on a wild goose chase, in search of a non-existent family heirloom. While on the road, fresh air and fresh perspectives cleared Karald's mind of his dark thoughts. Deciding to treat life as a great adventure, he turned his back firmly on his past and ditched bitterness on the side of the road.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The most beautiful flower can flourish from the blackest of despairs. Yes, hope does spring eternal.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of assisting a fair sovereign in repairing hearts and souls. I would only ask you to pay for my expenses: %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Kiya's philosophies are colored by her talents with life and water. She can and will instill hope back into any despairing heart with her unflinching conviction that life's promises are never out of reach.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My friends call me Gentle Giant. It's in your best interest to abstain until you have earned the right to do so.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of things gone to dust. Elemental has been overrun by midgets and they're crawling out of the woodwork. The time of Giants has come and gone and the ones remaining must somehow find their place in this reshaped world. I like you, you've been respectful to me and I value that. Yes I could join you ranks for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Mogrollo's origins remain shrouded in mystery and he's been stubbornly uncooperative to answer any questions concerning his past. Although he bears a distinct resemblance to Trolls, his skin color doesn't match and he cannot regenerate as they do. Nicknamed the Gentle Giant for his soft voice and tendency to whisper, Mogrollo is kind and protective to his friends to a fault. On the other hand, he has little tolerance for strangers, especially the arrogant and ignorant types who mistake him for a Troll, assume he has limited intelligence and address him in a loud tone of voice. Such interactions generally yield fatal results.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My blade speaks for me.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of perfect swordsmanship and becoming one with my blade. I'm a little tight on money and bare necessities at the moment. So for %d gildar, my sword is yours to command.
UnitType.Backstory: Moncrenas is a fighter at heart and his sword is his best and only true friend. Although he refuses to reveal anything about his past, Moncrenas' somber moods betray great tragedies.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Down here.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of being on the right scale with the rest of the world. Being permanently out of synch is no fun... Enough whining, for %d gildar, I'll bust kneecaps with my hammer.
UnitType.Backstory: Don't ever imply to Ofrond that he's living proof that the mythical Dwarves once populated the realms of Elemental. He tends to respond aggressively with his hammer during such conversations, busting legs with complete abandon. Offenders beware.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I do not seek fortune nor fame. I'm here to make a difference and fight the rampant apathy.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of getting things done faster. If only people would stop being so indolent! There's urgency in the air, we've got to act. Let's settle the matter of hiring me quickly: %d gildar. Hurry up please. Hey, there's a loafer over there twiddling his thumbs!
UnitType.Backstory: Pallary Paniard is a hyperactive person who cannot stand idleness. She will be insufferable to the lazy, will hunt down loafers and will make anyone feel guilty about taking a rest in her presence, no matter how well-deserved it might be. Bossy and peremptory, she's prompt to order people around with little regards to such concepts as rank or hierarchy. Watch out, here she comes!

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Poverty is not my destiny. Life owes me so much and the time has come to collect those debts.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of going from rags to riches. I have already lived several lives as an orphan, a beggar, a thief, a soldier for hire... Maybe I was born to nothing but I will hold my chin up as proudly as the mightiest queen. I can hold the fort for you for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Born to extreme deprivation, Rayna's first memories are of struggling to find her next meal in the freezing streets, beaten by the harsh piercing winds and harassed by cruel Kraxis soldiers. Despite so many doors closing before her, Rayna always managed to dissipate the clouds of despair threatening to enfold her and refused to give up the fight to claw herself to the top. Now a stronger woman for her brutal past, she has vowed to take her revenge on life and always get the biggest slice out of any pie.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Crumbling castles of sand are a thing of the past. I will build something to stand the test of time.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of departing sandy landscapes and setting foot on solid ground. I wish to settle down for good and start building and creating. A kingdom for example and for %d gildar, yours would also become mine.
UnitType.Backstory: A beautiful princess of the nomadic desert tribes, Razuda will tell you that she hasn't eaten a meal in her life without crunching sand with each bite. This pervasive sand which seeps in your boots and in your clothes, in your hair and in your eyes, in your mind and in your dreams. The unrelenting sand which erodes your perspectives and remodels your world in a matter of mere minutes. The shifting sand which will bury what you seek and uncover that which you'd rather not find. The volatile sand which imposes constant travel and tricks you with its dreamy illusions. The sand, this sand which Razuda would trade for a chance to build something solid, something real. For an opportunity to leave lasting tracks for a change.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'A rose is delicate and sweet until you get a fistful of thorns.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of full blooming and the sweet fragrance of a fresh rose to accompany me always. For %d gildar, I'll teach your army how to wake up and smell the roses.
UnitType.Backstory: Some say Rosa Thornn is a truly a rose given human form. It might be a tad preposterous but disturbing signs would leave doubts into the mind of the fiercest skeptic.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I'm a legendary war general in the making. Mark my words.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of leading fantastic armies into battle. I'm tired of interior strategizing, maps and metallic figurines. For %d gildar, my ambitions and leadership skills will lead your armies to the ultimate victory.
UnitType.Backstory: Originating from a family of war generals, Rosmund always knew he'd become a famous military prodigy. Defying his uncle who felt he should acquire more solid theoretical foundations before trying his hand at field-testing, Rosmund hotheadedly threw his books away and decided to do just the opposite. With the consequence of stalling his progress and killing his future as the commander of legend he aspired to be. Boys will be boys.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I don't juggle solely with axes, I also use Fallen heads quite often.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of quenching this hatred within. First there was the fight for independence and then the Fallen invasion. So much left to do. For %d gildar, I will provide you with unique and deadly services.
UnitType.Backstory: Tavara Mendolas is an angry woman who has taken a very active role in the rebellion and participated in raids against Fallen settlements. She distinguished herself when she infiltrated an Urxen camp and murdered Kongas The Butcher, the infamous warlord whose bloody rampage destroyed entire Tarthan communities.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Putting a little fun back into adventuring.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of great adventure and laughing my behind off along the way. I'll lighten the mood of your troops for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Theovord is a brash young warrior with a sense of humor that just never stops. There's always a joke to be told on a bloody battlefield.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Say, you wouldn't happen to have a decent shield I could borrow?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of becoming a true soldier again. It's all I know to do and as I can't seem to find my way back to my company, I thought I might join yours. I'm a veteran fighter and follow orders to the letter. For a modest soldier's pay of %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Second class Shieldman Thorngale claims to be a soldier of the fifth company of the eighth battalion of the fourth regiment. Of which army still remains to be ascertained but looking at the sorry state of his battered equipment, his journey hasn't been a restful one up to this point. Disrepair, destitution and dishonor threatening to engulf him in their cruel clutches, Thorngale seeks a new employer to fight for. And if the latter comes with a new set of ideals, his malleable loyalties will manage to adapt, especially if the latest technologies are available to upgrade his dingy equipment.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'While the blade of Justice must always remain sharp as a razor, my modest gavel will settle disputes and keep the peace.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of being one the lawmakers to bring back due process to these ravaged lands. The fact that citizens are taking the law into their own hands is unacceptable. Believe me, true peace can only be found once a fair and structured legal system is in place. I have plenty of ideas already and for %d gildar I will lay the legal foundations of your kingdom.
UnitType.Backstory: A certified magistrate, Umpire Verrick strives to enforce a semblance of equity in these unlawful times. Offering his services as an arbiter, he will always thoroughly explain his decisions until he convinces both parties to accept the correctness of his rulings. His impartiality and probity are universally recognized and his services are increasingly in demand.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Tomorrow is friendly territory.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of achieving greatness, of leaving something exceptional behind when I pass beyond the great veil. I feel there is enormous potential in you and for %d gildar, I would help you fulfill it.
UnitType.Backstory: Vestion is much younger than he looks, the intensity in his gaze adding years to his face. His gaunt appearance doesn't help either, the energies constantly swirling within him are inevitably eating him up. Quite a few worry that he'll suddenly go out like a light one day, without warning.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My husband and child were executed before my eyes. While I failed to save mine, I take the solemn oath to protect yours.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of... well my life's a joke and I can only find despair at the end of the tunnel. The Fallen trash took everything from me and I intend to make them pay. For %d gildar, I will spill their blood mercilessly.
UnitType.Backstory: Volene Shoredale was the commander of a small outpost destined to become a future settlement as the wilderness was slowly being driven back. Claiming encroachment on their ancestral lands, Quendar slavers attacked the outpost and captured the handful manning it. Selecting Volene to be the object of their torment, they slowly tortured her husband and child and forced her to watch the gruesome proceedings until they killed them. That's when her eyes permanently clouded over. When they finally departed, leaving her bleeding and broken, hatred and despair had already taken complete control of her mind.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Don't believe the rumors.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of ending once and for all this idiotic "fallen noble" calumny that's been hanging over my head forever. For %d gildar, I'll help you with this conquest thing you've got going and who knows... Our association just might kill the rumors.
UnitType.Backstory: Some would say that Sir Bremath is the son of a disgraced Kraxis noble. That his reputation is one of debauchery and indolence. He will deny everything until he's blue in the face and swords are drawn.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Warfare and diplomacy are the two sides of the same coin.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of achieving masterful feats of diplomacy through excellence in negotiations. Your cause would benefit greatly from what I can offer, as I would always concede less to the other party than what is asked in return. I would enter your service for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Serving as an ambassador, Lady Cathezann has smoothed many ruffled feathers and her charm has permitted the signature of several important and difficult treaties. Her military skills hold no candle to her diplomatic ones as she is a capable leader, inspiring troops and awing enemies with her firm grasp of command.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Excellence can be likened to a cut diamond, a skilled craftsman might do wonders but he'll always be limited by the quality of the raw material at his disposal.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life that my name will naturally hand me on a platter of the finest and most precious material. If you wish to work with me, I will only accept if the position fits my stature and is second only to yours.
