If you agree to these conditions, there is also the matter of remuneration and be warned that I will not tolerate haggling: it's %d gildar up front.
UnitType.Backstory: The Wraithson name is a famous one in the Wraith Empire, a noble family whose roots can be traced back two millennia and which frequently intertwine with those of royalty. Raised in such a context, Clodrisse could hardly fail to be convinced of the superiority of her stock and intelligence. Haughty and dismissive, she often refuses to speak to commoners and when in an especially tumultuous mood, can be very heavy-handed when punishing servants for inconsequential slights. Shades of totalitarianism.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Is that gore on your shirt? I have this feeling we're going to get along just fine.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of gory battles and bathing in the blood of my enemies. Take no prisoners is my motto. Going into battle soon? Take me with you! %d gildar is my price.
UnitType.Backstory: A proponent of ultra violence, Drogath failed as a slaver for his incapacity to stay his hand while punishing his acquisitions. His partners tried many times to curb his costly rages but to no avail. When they finally decided to fire him, Drogath picked up his mace and crushed their skulls. His rage was such that he kept on pounding long after life had fled from their mangled bodies. Laughing off the incident, Drogath knew he had found his calling: the path of the warrior. From that moment on, he would be Drogath Gutwrencher.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Whenever someone complains about hunger, I help them out with a knuckle sandwich.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of... these questions annoy me! I'm a fighter, not a talker and if you want to recruit me just say so and pay me %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Hated and despised by the troops, Duckle is a harsh taskmistress who prefers to settle arguments with her fists rather than with words. While she will grudgingly respect her hierarchy, she will treat underlings little better than slaves, often giving beatings for such arbitrary reasons as a misplaced glance or a plea for rest. An accomplished warrior, the troops will forgive her cruelty when she's fighting by their side, swinging her axe with the savagery of a Demon from the pits of the Nether Realms.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I'm a speed demon stuck in a world moving in slow motion.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life in the fast lane. Quick, quick, gimme %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: A Goyarh Hedigah citizen, Edmas claims to possess extraordinary agility and speed. It's true that he does tend to blur at the edges.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Let the devastating conquests beget the crimson rivers to feed the Blood God's insatiable appetite.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of blood, blood and blood. Rivers, torrents, cascades of blood. The Blood God is our father, our sovereign, our master. Let us educate the masses and sacrifice the doubters and recalcitrant. I will be the one to conduct your religious ceremonies for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Ever since Euclibes formally joined the Cult of the Blood God, his speech patterns have dramatically altered. He can now only harangue in a loud pompous voice tinged with some undefined accent, constantly preaching to the masses. Sadly enough, there is rarely anyone listening to his gory sermons and his recruitment pitch systematically falls on deaf ears. His family and former friends now all refuse to see him, let alone speak to him, ever since he magically fused those freakish demon horns to his head. His brainwashing was so thorough that he now believes himself to be the Blood God's avatar on Elemental, with the call of murder and mass sacrifices tailing each of his sentences. All hail the sanguine and supreme patron of carnage and massacres! All hail the cardinal bloodletter! All hail the Blood God!

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The last person who told me that violence doesn't solve anything lost the argument at the end of my spearing retort.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of entering into the conscious collective's hall of fame of legendary Wraith warriors. And your crusade could be the opportunity I've been waiting for. Let's agree to %d gildar to get started and let the spearing begin.
UnitType.Backstory: After unveiling the secrets of the staff, Farvesa decided to try her hand at the spear. Her staff instructor expressed his disappointment openly and berated her choice harshly. Growing irritated with the insults, Farvesa challenged him to a match of staff versus spear. In the heat of the moment, she didn't hold back and killed him. The incident was ruled as an accident stemming from the inherent dangers of training. Hiding her glee at this disguised murder with increasing difficulty, Farvesa felt the time had come to pack her belongings and scram.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Concession is another name for weakness disguised in the form of compromise. I rule my swamps with absolute power and expect nothing less from you.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of keeping a watchful eye on my swamps and keeping all intruders out. And yet I ache to see the world at large. Tearing myself away from my marshes will be a physical pain but I will become mad if I remain here. Such a ball of contradiction eh? You don't know the half of it. Handing out %d gildar would facilitate my decision.
UnitType.Backstory: Who is the swamp lord known only as Ghar'Laak? Is he a strange Quendar mutant with pronounced human facial features? A cross between Man and Snake? One of the last survivors of an ancient race? Something else altogether? Considering himself to be the absolute ruler of his boggy domains, Ghar'Laak will rarely let interlopers pass unmolested, harassing them with a vast array of intricate traps. If the issue looks remotely favorable, he will engage the trespassers even if outnumbered, giving them a taste of his unique fighting techniques which blend brute power and ophidian speed. His only weakness is his crippling loneliness and the promise of companionship from a visitor who has earned his respect could lure him away from his beloved wetlands. For a time.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Make the wrong comment and I'll break your face.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of getting back at all of those who mocked me. I'm through taking lumps and I mean to dish out. For %d gildar, I'll accompany you while I search for those cowards.
UnitType.Backstory: Ghertrude suffered greatly as an Urxen child with her manly looks and deep voice. When she hit puberty and started developing facial hair, her difficulties increased a thousandfold. Now she is driven solely by anger and will break noses at the slightest mockery, whether real or imagined.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Like a moth to a flame.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life as an arsonist. For %d gildar, I'll light the flames, set the night on fire and burn your enemies' troops and cities to nothing but bad memories.
UnitType.Backstory: Horrad would have us believe he's a living furnace. There's no denying he has an ebullient personality.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Champion killer seeking employment so he can complete his head collection.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life as an executioner, to make those upstart adventurers bite the dust. For %d gildar, I'll join forces with you and that champion riffraff won't stand a chance.
UnitType.Backstory: Rumors say Juju is a prominent member of a secret caste of Trog executioners. Hearsay aside, there's no doubt his sanity left discreetly through the back door without prior notice.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: '[You definitely discern the word "BURN" among all the loud hisses].'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: Hisses, pops and whistles is all you get from this walking funeral pyre. He does seem to still understand the concept of money and will follow you around for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: The Cindercorpse Kolkulus has no recollection of his life prior to his transformation into a mobile pile of burning bones. His needs are rather simple and can be resumed in a single word: "burn". He will rarely speak anyway and on those rare occasions, will only eruct a loud hiss intermixed with pops and whistles. You can always try to ask him whether there is any truth behind the parable that Cindercorpses are reanimated Fire Mages whose spells backfired dramatically but if a response ever comes, you'd probably get a more interesting one from a log heartily burning in a fireplace.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The survival of the fittest is in full swing and I'm here to ensure that you'll be the last one standing.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of fame gained through conquest. War is the ultimate test. Let us face these trials together. My help will be invaluable in the times to come and all I ask is %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Daughter of Korvosh One-Eye, chief of the Blood Wolf clan, Korshava lamented her father's lack of vision as he refused to make a grab for power when a rival clan suffered heavy losses against a company of Free-Riders. Frustrated with the rampant inertia, Korshava voted with her feet. She seeks to put herself on the map and shower herself in the glory of conquest.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Up here.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of finding a mate I can look eye to eye without having to kneel. Towering over everyone has its perks of course but I also have a heart, you know... Anyway, for about %d gildar, I could show you the world through my eyes.
UnitType.Backstory: Luddock is truly a giant among his kind and many mean-spirited souls would whisper that his mother was on very friendly terms with an Ogre or even worse, a Troll. Unable to find anything but reluctant acceptance and suffering from isolation, Luddock kissed his tearful mother goodbye and left for greener pastures. Given his size, Luddock unfortunately tends to act as a lightning rod, to the relief of the surrounding trees.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Once I gain entry, the mere idea of cleansing the infection amounts to either delusion or wishful thinking.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of disseminating my own variety of infection and gleefully observe the pain it brings to those on the receiving end. It's a great source of pleasure for me, one that really doesn't diminish over time. I could give you a demonstration, say on these soldiers of yours? No? Your call but if you find my unique potential appealing, it will cost you %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Merula is a horrible, horrible woman -not physically speaking as she can be quite pleasing to the eyes- who has an evil mind to give demonic overlords a run for their money. A proficient mage, she has discovered a way to bridge opposite schools of magic and through her own unique brand of perversity, proceeded to twist it for harmful and painful applications. She will use the poison of the earth and carry its contagious pathogens by manipulating air forces, spreading infection on a massive scale and bring entire crowds to their knees. Unarguably, she would be a wonderful asset for the war effort but will require a high level of maintenance. If boredom sets in by lack of opponents to torment, she'll be inclined to turn on your own soldiers without so much as an afterthought. She is after all a horrible, horrible woman.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'How about a dark mass to bring your spirits down?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of dark rituals and demon summonings. I would chant dark liturgies and summon hellspawns for you. For a modest contribution of %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Naduuru was a wizard's apprentice when he was seduced by an accidentally summoned minor demon. His morals and rationality evaporated and his only goal now is to feel demonic energies slide down the back of his corrupted soul. Whatever the cost.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Poor treatment and lack of respect are the fertilizers for betrayals and rebellions.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of becoming one of the greatest mages, of course! A little ambition is healthy and pushes one to always reach a little further. And if I can work in a respectful environment, then you'll get my best. For wages, I would ask to start with an advance of %d gildar. We can discuss further details later.
UnitType.Backstory: When Nucius was curtly told to sweep his master's laboratory and clean up several failed experiments of an explosive nature, he started harboring violent resentment at being treated little better than a Quendar slave. Working himself into a fury, he accidentally set his broom on fire. As soon as the flames reached the volatile solution his master had been working on, they devoured the rest of the laboratory in a matter of minutes. Still furious and unrepentant, Nucius openly laid the blame on his master's gross negligence, lack of safeguards and poor working ethics, telling any who would listen that he was quitting ahead of time in order to preserve his life. Feeling he had learned enough, he shed his apprentice clothes and proclaimed himself a full-fledged mage.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Poison green is such a beautiful color.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of finding the perfect alchemical combinations for the most potent and lethal poisons. It's an art I tell you. You could add my toxic self to your band of merrymakers for... say %d gildar?
UnitType.Backstory: Prelesh is a disturbed individual who's probably poisoned entire communities for his sole amusement. He doesn't necessarily go for the lethal stuff as inflicting stomach cramps or the Darkling flu will bring him just as much satisfaction.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The flame burning eternally within my mind only seeks to be fed.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of dancing the furnace jig with the Fire Elementals. For %d gildar, I'll turn your enemies to kindling and watch them burn.
UnitType.Backstory: Purpurra's constant obsession with fire and her exposure to high levels of magical energies have altered her brain chemistry. She's magically talented but somewhat unstable, if not downright insane.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Lofty ambitions and the magic to back them up.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of renewal through the purification brought by seasonal changes. Not following me? Anyhow, %d gildar will guarantee my cooperation.
UnitType.Backstory: As a Quendar, R'Kol is something of an anomaly as the potential for extreme cold is awaiting development through magical experimentation. Always feeling chilled around him, his fire loving brethren tend to shun him as a consequence.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'If you want a mud fight, I'll supply the arena.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of watching kingdoms sink into mudpits of my own making. Yeah I know, strange cravings but there it is. For %d gildar, I'll put those quicksands under your enemies' cities.
UnitType.Backstory: An eccentric Trog if there ever was one, Rollaglunu is a Mage obsessed with mud who will talk endlessly about wet grounds and squishy paths. He takes particular delight in turning battlefields into quagmires and watching hapless enemies slosh through viscous slime.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Something's rotten in Elemental and it ain't my personality.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for an unlife of corrupting everyone and everything. Literally and figuratively speaking. That's advanced putrescence for you and for %d gildar, I promise to save my sticky and sweet ministrations for your enemies. Let's rot away!
UnitType.Backstory: At first Rostoff only had rotten teeth, the horrifically bad kind. Then he had rotten gums, the constantly swollen and bleeding kind. Afterwards, he had a rotten temper to match, the foul and aggressive kind. Now Rostoff is rotten all over, from head to toe, and he has every intention to share the wealth. If you intend to collaborate with this difficult and misguided creature, the key rule is to always remain upwind. Always.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'If you choose to collaborate with me, I will safeguard your assets from magical defilements.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of proving that Wraiths don't need magic to make a name for themselves in the world. I have been called the bane of mages while growing up because I can disrupt complicated spells very easily. Yes I can protect you from supernatural attacks and that would require %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: While she never possessed much magical talent to call her own, Ruggara Emerstone always had the uncanny ability to scramble and disrupt others' spells. A playful child, she was the bane of the magical community and her parents had to isolate her until she gained some maturity. On the cusp of adulthood, she decided to put her odd gift to use and become a bodyguard who specializes in protecting her charges against magical aggressions.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Urban development demands permanent solutions to providing bare necessities for your citizens. I bring water power.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of applying my methods of city management. Providing clean water is first and foremost and you won't go far if you don't quench the thirst of your empire. I could take care of this for you, for the very modest sum of %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: When the river around which Rundya's native village had been founded was magically diverted leagues upstream, the consequences were immediate and disastrous. Crops failed and livestock had to cross dangerous territories to gain access to water. Teaming up with another fledgling water practitioner, Rundya managed to undo the damage and pull the river back in its original bed. Victory was short-lived however as an infuriated lordling sent his army to crush this affront to his authority and raze the village. Now homeless, Rundya wanders in search of promising new beginnings.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'When survival is at stake, a brutal nature will make the difference between life and death.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of crushing things big and small. I'm not picky about these things. I'll whack them all for a mere %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: A brute to the very core, Shurtash is fearless and careless in battle, sometimes whacking his own teammates while in a frenzy.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Underlings soon understand it's best to obey me.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of reaching the ultimate power level and rule. Ha ha ha, I'm jesting of course or am I? Anyhow if you need some disciplinary measures to be implemented, I'm the woman for the job. If you can afford me for %d gildar that is.
UnitType.Backstory: Contessa Urlessa's star has been on the rise in the Kraxis Empire, a noblewoman with a thirst for power and intrigue. She's quite gifted in choosing her alliances and tearing the competition apart. A talented governess, she suffers no contradiction from her subordinates.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Give me your greenest recruits and I will mercilessly put them through the grinder and carve them into the deadliest weapons.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of being known as Elemental's best military instructor. Which I already am in fact. You see I get results and I don't coax them from the troops. I demand them. Wimps and sissies need not apply. Get my drift? Your soldiers really could use a firmer hand and for %d gildar, I will shape them into elite troops in no time.
UnitType.Backstory: Vatello Jonoko is one of the best military instructors around, the sort who can push his charges to act much faster without so much as an introduction. Woe to the fool who would speak of wooden swords and practice dummies, Vatello only trains his troops in situ, with real weapons and real opponents. Fatalities will necessarily occur and they are welcomed for they allow a rapid separating of the wheat from chaff. Only the best will remain, battle bred and with the scars to prove it, fit to serve as the elite troops of a demanding sovereign. Yes, trainer extraordinaire Vatello Jonoko is ruthless and maybe even heartless but he'll shape your rookies into hardened veterans in just a few skirmishes.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Once you've tasted the vital energy of another, that sweetest of nectars, you are condemned to always crave for more.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of consuming the vital energies of others. Now don't judge! Until you've felt the incredible rush that accompanies such transfers, you can't possibly understand these urges. I would gladly join your ranks for %d gildar, just as long as there is a sizable stack of enemies to siphon dry.
UnitType.Backstory: Trying to gain an edge against Watuna, her rival for the affections of their clan leader Forfren, Vuspera decided to raid some promising ancient tombs which had somehow escaped the keen eyes of experimented robbers. Inside the third coffin, she found her precious Dagger of the Leech amidst a pile of strangely reddened bones. Returning to her village, she was confronted by an aggressive Watuna who attacked her. After sustaining a few minor injuries, Vuspera managed to hit Watuna in turn, felt a flood of incredible power rush inside her and found that her cuts had been miraculously healed. Drained and shaken, Watuna tried in vain to put a stop to the hostilities. Incapable of resisting the urge to siphon more energy, Vuspera stabbed her until she gave the fatal blow. Her sobering didn't last long as the vampiric nature of the blade took control. To satisfy her cravings, she began attacking animals and even chose to become an assassin for hire as a front for darker purposes. After using the dagger for so long, some magical transfer eventually took place and Vuspera is now capable of reaping life on her own, without its assistance.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The prolonged scream which accompanied the end of my life is still bubbling in my throat and shall not fall on deaf ears when it finds release.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of... well now that it's over I can't really respond now can I? I will dedicate this new existence to disproving false rumors and wild folktales. And if foolishness can't be cured, I can turn my screams into invincible arguments. Screeches for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Angrella scoffed at Nikko's parroting of the local wild tales which affirmed that the Dragonmaw Pit was a bottomless well leading to infinity and thus nowhere. Growing terribly annoyed with such open ignorance, Angrella shouted that she would throw her practice sword far into the pit, climb down and bring it back to disprove these ridiculous assertions. Despite Nikko's pleas, she refused to back down and started going down the treacherous cliffs after tossing her weapon in the gaping chasm. Several hours later, with no end in sight, with her hands bleeding and her muscles cramping, Angrella was having strong misgivings about this foolhardy venture, especially as she had hotheadedly laughed at the idea of bringing supplies for the journey. While waiting for a bout of nausea to pass, she was suddenly attacked by a bird of prey whose nest was dangerously close by. Losing grip and footing, she tumbled and fell, screaming, screaming, screaming... She did hit bottom eventually -thus disproving these ridiculous fabrications- picked up her battered sword and floated back to the surface to gloat in Nikko's face. This is the point in the story where Angrella becomes silent, leaving her listeners wondering how Nikko reacted to the horror of being confronted with her triumphant ghostly form.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Speaking as a staunch defender of the realms, you are now under my protection.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of protecting my kind against those that would cause grief and mayhem, in other words Empire types. For %d gildar, I will insure your protection.
UnitType.Backstory: Anierbilar is kin to royalty and while he has no claim for a throne, he does have a claim to fame.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Once the body is repaired, serenity and prayers are the tools to heal the soul.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of theological studies and prayers. Join me in worshiping the gift of life. A modest contribution of %d gildar for the service would be greatly appreciated.
UnitType.Backstory: Aremalia is a profoundly religious person whose firm precepts are the sanctity of life and the redemption of the soul. Truly selfless, she's been known to put herself in dire danger in order to bring relief to a wounded soldier, keeping death at bay while weapons are clanging all around.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I may look a little worse for wear but that's only evidence of many roads traveled and many deeds accomplished.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of going back to my keep, back to the land that I love. But as a errant knight, it is my duty to seek out trouble and give succor where it is the most needed. Your intentions seem to mirror mine and I would ally myself with you. We can do good together. For the reasonable sum of %d gildar, you're getting a proficient knight with a spotless reputation.
UnitType.Backstory: For all his boasting and bragging about chivalrous deeds and rescuing damsels in distress, Sir Donwald is in reality a landless hedge knight with a rather sordid reputation. It can be heard through the grapevine that he joined a gang of highwaymen for a time though he will deny it if confronted. His equipment is mostly recycled and of various origins. Gildarless and crestfallen, Sir Donwald still believes he is more than a vulgar sellsword and that his luck is bound to pick up.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Hear the roar of my commands.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of finding the right lioness, one that would fit my pride. Get it? Har har! Well let's be serious for a minute. You won't find a better commander in these parts. My orders can penetrate the thickest skull and the dullest mind. I have the voice to lead your soldiers to new heights, that is if you would part with %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: A jovial and boisterous fellow, Garrast Lionmane loves to fraternize and share a horn of wine with his soldiers during downtime. He will slap backs, tell bawdy jokes and regal his entranced audience with his incredible tales. When things get serious however, the commander takes over and pleasantries evaporate just as easily as forgotten memories. His voice is his most powerful weapon, an almighty roar rending the air, capable of rallying troops and breaking enemy morale apart.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'You can only move forward if you can hear and accept criticisms.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of freedom of speech and expression. Those rights would be inalienable and would be written in a founding text. Too modern for these times you say? Maybe so, maybe so... If you wish to hear my constructive criticisms and see me project acid on your enemies, my price is %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Gattrina's potty mouth and strong tendency to gossip caught up with her one day when her slanders reached the ears of a powerful wizard. Incensed by the insults, the magician cursed her with an acid mouth as punishment for her vile words, forcing her to spit constant streams of corrosive saliva.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'No I'm not a lumberjack and I don't use these big things to chop wood.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of proving that I've got the biggest and sharpest axe around. For %d gildar, I will show you just how much. Let's swing.
UnitType.Backstory: Issmund is the best warrior to come out of his promotion of elite shock troops. After loyally serving his native kingdom, he decided to try his hands at a bit of adventuring. Fame or failure awaits but whichever comes, his heart is confident.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Proactive scouting lays the groundwork for successful invasions.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of grand archery and will participate in any tourney to prove my skills. For %d gildar, I'll always score a bull's eye.
UnitType.Backstory: Jertan is a veteran archer, an unparalleled ranger and a brilliant mountaineer capable of blending with his environment. Although he prefers his secluded forests, he cannot resist entering archery competitions.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Don't ask me whether I feel more Kraxis than Gilden.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of beating down the barriers of ignorance. For %d gildar, I'll enlighten your way to knowledge.
UnitType.Backstory: Fostered by Kraxis nobles, Jonelda was called "Imperax" behind her back because of her clothes style and manners. What was intended to be slander only fueled her pride and encouraged her eccentric inclinations.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'If fireflies are ephemeral in nature, my mantle of flames is eternal and as unremitting as my pain.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of... I have no illusions left stranger. I'm in permanent pain, always burning up and yet never getting consumed. Maybe I'm just a Cindercorpse in the making or have become a unique kind of demonic entity. Yes I would be willing to help you build your kingdom and maybe we'll meet someone along the way who can help me out. I will only ask for %d gildar as I realize I'm something of a fire hazard.
UnitType.Backstory: The tragic story of Locruten, squire of Sir Genvad, is spreading like wildfire throughout Elemental, so to speak. Genvad, Locruten and a small troop of men were on a routine patrol when they were savagely attacked by a mad Wraith Wizard. The latter cast a fireball which killed the entire patrol. Except for Locruten. While he initially incinerated like the others, a strange reaction occurred and his body stored the magical energies until it could no longer contain them. The sudden discharge shook the heavens, killed the dumbfounded wizard and accelerated the incineration of his companions. A returning scout witnessed the entire scene and now recounts on a daily basis the day Locruten became a human torch, surrounded by eternal flames which could not consume him. Heartbroken, disfigured, charred and in permanent pain, Locruten now desperately awaits a denouement to his predicament, whether a miraculous healing or the tragic fate of a Cindercorpse.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Trainers are not soldiers and have no business trading blows in real battles.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of ledgers and accounts. For %d gildar, I'll crunch those numbers for you.
UnitType.Backstory: Prefect Lumias is a talented administrator who also dabs in coaching troops whenever his workload allows it. He's clearly not a soldier however and has a pathological aversion to front lines.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The power of the seas is mine to command and I can turn the tide of this war in your favor.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of merging with the oceans. The sea sings to me like a siren and I long to surrender to its call. I can bring the waves to your side and for an influx of %d gildar, I'll clear the Fallen flotsam and jetsam from your shores.
UnitType.Backstory: A seafarer's daughter, Marina has spent her entire childhood sailing across the seas and oceans of Elemental. Whenever she was aboard her mother's ship, the currents were always favorable and the sailing smooth and perfect. Nicknamed "Charmarina" by the crew, Marina's mother finally realized that her daughter had control over the elements when coincidences kept stacking up. Both agreed that some tutelage by a Water Master was sorely needed and Marina remained on firm ground for several years. The war would eventually separate the family when her mother's ship was reported lost at sea.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Warfare is bloody and dirty but with a touch of class and finesse, honor lies at the end of the bumpy road.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of commanding legions to new heights. For %d gildar, I will train and lead your troops to the gates of the Underworld if necessary.
UnitType.Backstory: Murtenn was born with a sword in his hand and his military upbringing has shaped him to become a great knight. There still remains the matter of accomplishing those great deeds of courage and valor but he's getting there.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I may have been lost for a hundred years but you've found me at the perfect time.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life, well an unlife if you wish to nitpick, of making up for all the lost time. Yes, I can hear the snickers at yet another joke on my name... I may no longer have a kingdom but I can help you build yours for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Novord the third was a benevolent king who embarked upon the famed quest of the Felicity Chalice, an artifact of legend believed to confer omnipotence to its owner. Craving to usher an era of prosperity in a period of drought, Novord left with a band of trusted companions to secure the Chalice only to vanish from the surface of Elemental. He has now come back, a hundred years too late and still empty handed, to lend assistance in bringing about the prosperity he failed to deliver in his time.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Whether you are commanding individuals or ruling the masses, inherent knowledge of the human heart is the master key to open all doors.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of getting a chance to prove my abilities as a commander. My talents may still be fledgling but if you would be willing to let me lead some of your troops, believe me you'll be glad you did. And I would only ask for %d gildar!
UnitType.Backstory: When her older brother tumbled down the watchtower stairs and broke his back, it fell, so to speak, upon Ociniere's shoulders to take over his duties and supervise the training of the family keep's small garrison. A natural leader, Ociniere honed her skills and found her calling: she would deploy and command armies to triumph. Now to do it on a grander scale.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I am Life's response to the Undead uprising. The holy crusade has begun!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of wiping out the Undead filth that keeps gaining ground. Necromancers are coming out of the woodwork and violating the tombs of our forefathers. This cannot be allowed to continue! For %d gildar, I will turn you into a crusader at the service of Life and crush the Undead at your side.
UnitType.Backstory: Armed with the sacred Angelic Longsword, her potent healing powers and her ardent faith in her righteous duty, Purity is Life's champion given flesh, a paladin reborn to face the Undead plague spreading through Elemental. She will show no mercy for Necromancers violating the remains of the Dead, their vile desecrations impossible to pardon. Intransigent when it comes to her hallowed assignment, Purity will suffer no delays and no arguments getting in the way of the complete annihilation of the Undead.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'All roads lead to Hope.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of building highways and tunneling through mountains. I would always keep your chariots in their ruts for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Traffic flow and optimum traveling are Quarryne Castellan's specialties. She always has three new projects in mind before finishing the one at hand and her hammer constantly clinks with enthusiasm.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Preservation sometimes necessitates firm action.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of defending my kin from the constant threats that keep cropping up. These are dangerous times my friend. For %d gildar, I will preserve your lands and allow your kingdom to thrive.
UnitType.Backstory: Reskavie has earned his fighting credentials in several arenas. If he's been knocked down a few times, he gave back as good as he received. Reskavie has taken it upon himself to become a rampart against the constant turmoil, a protector of the fragile and weak against the encroaching darkness.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Now that destiny has merged our paths, the stuff of legends starts here.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of great wizardly deeds and the fame that goes along with them. I would be willing to sprinkle some sorceress dust and help your cause for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Sabeth is a locally famous Mage who intends to expand her horizons and push her star into the realms of the legendary.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Assassin of the highest order. With glamour.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of gambling with the souls and belongings of those rich and fat palace denizens, pulling strings from the shadows and striking when least expected. For %d gildar, I would put my vast talents and wicked charms at your service.
UnitType.Backstory: Often dismissed as a foppish dandy, Serrakis really is a deadly assassin who hides himself behind rakish smiles and glittery vestments. He knows how to charm and lull his targets into a false sense of security and to strike masterfully when least expected.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Modern warfare requires modern weaponry. Allow me to demonstrate.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of stepping into a new age of technology and leaving behind our forefathers' obsolete methods of warfare. The Cataclysm has sent us back to the dark ages and only technological breakthroughs will permit us to reach enlightenment. Joining your ranks? Oh yes I would be thrilled to but that would require %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Talome is a self-proclaimed modernist, always eager to try out new armor and weapon designs. She has an unwavering faith in the collective ingenuity which will pull civilization from the stone age to an era of prosperity by way of technological discoveries. A crossbow apologist, she has frequent arguments with archers over its merits, championing it sometimes so extremely that she crosses the threshold of prevarication.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Have you seen my horse?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of honor won in glorious battles. I've been training all my life and I've got the muscles to show for it. I need %d gildar and I'll pledge my sword to you. Have you seen my horse by the way?
UnitType.Backstory: When his father's estates were burned to cinders during the endless wars, Wildhem had two choices: fighting back or dedicating himself to reconstruction. The former was never in question and picking up the sword of his ancestors, he walked towards his glorious destiny.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Let us now gambol to the sound of clashing blades.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of acquiring the stature of Shantham The Bold, the perfect swordsman of legend. I've still got a few moves to perfect but I feel my objectives are within my grasp. For %d gildar, I could show you how close I am.
UnitType.Backstory: Often comparing his sword duels to dances, Ascam is indeed a talented performer whose choreographed moves have tricked many eyes into falling out of step with the music to lethal consequences.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Soldiers should never be more than mindless drones and it's a commander's duty to bring them back safely to the hive.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of showing all those loudmouths who dared to criticize my methods that I can easily reproduce my successes on my own. I was the most efficacious army commander, with the best rate of accomplished missions and the lowest casualty percentage. The only thing I earned was jealousy and calumnies. I have seen you in action and have not found you wanting. I could take care of your armies for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: The Quendar commander Azano'Theus has been both praised and mocked by the military hierarchy. Praised for his exceptional mastery of battle tactics and application of warfare theories. Mocked for caring for his slave soldiers and avoiding needless casualties. Growing obsessed with the unfair criticisms, blowing them out of proportion, he abandoned his post on a whim and purposefully left the slave pen open as a parting gift. Perfectly aware that his skills are in high demand, Azano'Theus is discriminately monitoring the local sovereigns, looking for the right one before introducing himself.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'No prey can be qualified as off-limits. If there is a challenge, I'm always game.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of completing my trophy rack with exceptional additions. My ultimate goal is to strike a Dragon down and become a legendary huntress, one the Trogs will remember for generations to come. I see you're clearing out some wilderness. If you want an exceptional professional at your side, %d gildar will have to change pockets.
UnitType.Backstory: A huntress of the extreme, Dantifolia is frequently seen in taverns listening to gossip and wild stories of bloodthirsty monsters attacking and dismembering innocent victims. While most stories are pure exaggerations, Dantifolia knows there's usually a kernel of truth behind the embellishments and maybe an unusual prey waiting to be tracked down and meet its maker at the end of her spear. Always up to a new challenge, Dantifolia knows her trophy rack will never be complete until Dragon parts are added to her sinister collection.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Sure my sword can hack and slash and slice and dice. It can also loosen tongues with disconcerting ease.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of finding new martial techniques and putting them to good use. For %d gildar, I could give a taste of that expertise to your opponents.
UnitType.Backstory: When Grevienne's parents forbade her to touch another sword, she slammed the door in their faces and left. She enlisted and survived many harsh campaigns, earning her stripes along the way.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Brawn, smarts and a handsome face all in one great package.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of toppling over the arrogant elite and well... playing with the wenches too. %d gildar will afford my services.
UnitType.Backstory: Jackdar has little qualms about his violent nature and can be prone to fits of uncontrolled rage, especially after a drink or two. He also believes he's the Titans' gift to women.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I can be the lightning rod of your Empire, absorbing and dissipating the charge of your adversaries.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of putting the gift I was given by the skies to good use. And I have found none better than to seek out the famous Sovereign that you are and putting my hammer at your service. For %d gildar, I will make your enemies dance to the rhythm of flashing electrocution.
UnitType.Backstory: While his unit was being deployed in a barren area, Jebrael was hit by lightning during an especially violent thunderstorm. Knocked prone and charged with electricity, he glowed like a miniature sun for three days to the cries of his fellow soldiers, alternating between horror and wonder. When he finally awoke, the glow disappeared and he knew he had been forever transformed by the ordeal. Jebrael is now constantly charging up electricity, storing it within his cells until he is ready to release the fury of the skies to devastating effects.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'A spiky mace in your dirty face. Yes I'm a poet of sorts in my lost hours.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of sparring with other pros and of course, besting them. For %d gildar, I'd be willing to team up with your forces. Unless you'd rather fight?
UnitType.Backstory: Karrikara has left trails of blood behind her and her victories keep stacking up, making her one of the deadliest female Quendar warriors for hire.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Keeping the masses in line requires cajoling them with an iron fist.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of finding the optimal production equation. You know, finding how far you can oppress the masses before they break. I'll pursue my studies and share the results for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Litunas has long studied the effects of oppression on the productivity of the masses and is still researching the perfect dosage of elusive liberties to bestow at the right time to keep spirits high under extreme duress. While her efficiency is hard to deny, Litunas' intransigence can push her to crush her charges beyond exhaustion.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Behind every victim lies the intense pleasure of cutting the strings holding that puppet to life.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of heading my own organization of... licensed enforcers. Anyway, I know where it hurts the most and I would ask for %d gildar to deliver all that special damage.
UnitType.Backstory: Loreske has permanent memberships in several criminal organizations and her goals include becoming the head honcho of her own elite guild of mercenaries. She lacks funds and has resorted to selling her skills to the highest bidder.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'It's best to let others spread the word.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of... well that would be telling now wouldn't it? Maybe I'll give you some answers for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Through charm, wit and non negligible magical abilities, Maldo Khornan surged through several Kraxis power tiers in record time. Shrouded in an aura of mystery, his name is whispered as a potential reserve should tragedy befall the highest circles of state.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'If you fail to achieve your aims and intents in this life, there is always a second chance to be found in the hereafter.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life, well a second life of legendary accomplishments. Since I no longer possess a beating heart, my mind will have to suffice. Emotions de damned. For %d gildar, I let you have a piece of my glorious cake.
UnitType.Backstory: As the beautiful heiress of a noble Kraxis family, Morgia thought herself to be a princess with excellent prospects and the brightest of futures. She even envisioned approaching Emperor Karavox and wooing him with her charms and wits. Her name would touch Elemental's history for sure. It was while daydreaming in the sunny Goyarh Hedigah streets, elaborating her plans of seduction and intrigue that she was trampled by one of Karavox's mounted messengers. The delivery was so urgent that he didn't even bother to stop his tracks. Morgia's thoughts were so focused when the horse barreled into her that she didn't realize at first that her incorporeal form was standing a few feet from her mangled mortal shell. After witnessing the resulting panic in the streets when the law-abiding citizens ran away from her, Morgia realized that she would indeed have a destiny of the unique kind.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I'll be there to guide you when you're walking through the burning coals.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of being more than just a figurehead and lighting fires during festivals. There's too much energy within asking for release to limit myself to these mundane tasks. For %d gildar, I'll incinerate and burn at leisure.
UnitType.Backstory: Nabelva became the official fire adept of her tribe when she successfully completed the trial of the red path, consisting in walking a hundred paces barefooted through burning coals. Growing bored with the position which turned out to be ceremonial in nature, Nabelva answered the call of arms and decided to feed the flames of war with her considerable powers.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Magic at the service of expanding the influence of the Dark Arts.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of inventing new curses, hexes and enchantments thus furthering and deepening the arts. I would consent to work some spells for you for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Norette is an accomplished sorceress who has decided to test her theories empirically and pit her talents against other practitioners. Let the sparks fly, so to speak.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Battles should be carefully planned or not fought at all.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of just thinking things through. I know we're at war but you can't rush headlong into danger without several backup plans. I'll plan your battles and will save lives, time and gildar so you can concentrate on bigger things. My services for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Pongro Rezak is the careful planner, the meticulous strategist who will always choose to consolidate before expanding, to defend before attacking. While he is often dismissed as erring on the side of caution, Pongro has time and again extracted many intrepid fools from disastrous situations, saving the day without ever allowing himself to gloat.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I have a permanent cure for insomnia. My tender ministrations can put anyone into a deep sleep. The eternal kind.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of fame and riches. The face of Elemental is changing so rapidly, there are many opportunities to be seized, like so many ripe grapes on a vine. I have unique talents and can put your enemies in a special kind of slumber. It will cost you %d gildar or I will move to the next Empire to see if they are more generous with their coin.
UnitType.Backstory: The assassin working under the alias of Poppy Sleepmaker possesses the preternatural ability to slow down the vital signs of anyone she touches. She then dispatches the sluggish victims easily, putting them to a permanent kind sleep. Remorseless and opportunistic, she will invariably work for the employer with the fattest reserve of gildar.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I'll build a pathway to the gates of the Underworld.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of open roads of my own engineering. Your empire would benefit mightily from my expertise. My price is %d gildar, take it or leave it.
UnitType.Backstory: Sounds of beating hammers accompany Ravda Stonecutter wherever she goes as she's always building something. A capable administrator, Ravda prefers being outdoors where she can design her interconnecting highways.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Pale as a ghost and cold as a corpse. Approach me at your own risk.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of discovering the secrets of immortality and reproducing Agonis' visionary spells. Yes you guessed it, my aim is to transform this fragile form into that of an invincible Lich, the highest and most noble undead. We could become allies in the meantime, I'm most interested in those ruins you explore. For %d gildar, I would bring the Undead under your banner.
UnitType.Backstory: Ravenna Maelstrom is a necromancer who despises her mortality above all things and endeavors to reproduce the magical process by which Agonis transformed himself into a Lich, the most powerful form of Undead. Having developed an aversion to physical contact, she cannot abide to touch living flesh which comes with its disgusting warmth, beating hearts and bodily functions. She is frequently found surrounded by skeletons she summoned herself and which act as a protective barrier against the invasive world of the Living.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Yes shadows also have their elite warriors and I am their somber king cloaked in darkness.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of tending my flowerbeds and manicuring my garden in peace. Hark hark! Show me the next victim to be cut into pieces. Let's settle the small matter of payment first: %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: An overachiever in matters of bloodshed and mayhem, Toris Somber aims to darken your days and your general mood.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Even battlefields need administrating.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of planning the war effort and managing occupied territories. For %d gildar, I could unburden you of these administrative tasks.
UnitType.Backstory: Triggen has earned his "Wise" title for intelligent economic designs in warfare. He has also shown competence as a training instructor though the troops usually dislike him for his snobbish and pedantic manners.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Hard as granite, sturdy as the roots of mountains, my name is Vortham Rockskin.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of proving I can resist anything, whether storm or axes, earthquakes or charging cavalries. For %d gildar, I could give your army a rock solid foundation of power.
UnitType.Backstory: Vortham Rockskin likes to recount the day he was attacked by a pack of Earth Shrills. He prevailed after a dirty battle, earth flying everywhere. Through some magical fluke or perhaps divine intervention, his skin acquired the hardness and color of the Shrills' tough hide.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'A knife in your back, courtesy of Waragda.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of coming up with original ways to perform unique assassinations. For %d gildar, you name the victim and I'll do the rest.
UnitType.Backstory: Waragda is an assassin who has decided to test her mettle on the battlefield, from shadowy curtains to open mayhem. She's arrogant and rarely accepts to be rebuffed without exacting some form of payback such as poisoning food or hobbling mounts.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Ghosts do not have the monopoly of haunting souls.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of chilling hearts on a global scale. I would strike terror into your enemies for %d gildar, that is... if you think you'll have the fortitude of mind to be around me.
UnitType.Backstory: Zewakar is a Haunter inclined to participate in current events and spread his vile curses on a wider scale. He takes delight in spooking his own companions who claim he visits their dreams at night, turning them into vicious nightmares.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Wisdom comes with old age. I'd apologize for such a horrible cliche but I'm not ready to admit I actually said one.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of restfulness and tranquility and we all know that means pacifying those unruly crowds. For %d gildar, I'll manage your cities with finesse and the utmost competence.
UnitType.Backstory: Astevon Grayhair is a veteran of legendary campaigns. He claims his skills as a governor were then greatly appreciated by the leading generals. He wouldn't be the first to have a creative resumé.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The chaos of war turned into an art of self-discipline.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of self attunement amongst the surrounding chaos. And let me tell you, there is no better place for this exercise than a bloody battlefield. For a mere %d gildar, I will bring that peace to your army.
UnitType.Backstory: Eglis Wrathu is something of a philosopher behind that warrior figure. He will bash heads and search for inner peace at the same time.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'A sharp blade backed with the powers of the sky will strike vital points at incredible speeds.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of adventurous detours and walking on tightropes. Agility and dexterity have their price... %d gildar would be a fair one.
UnitType.Backstory: Gremen Talion is something of a prodigy, allying speed and dexterity to devastating effects. A deadly blade riding on a brisk wind.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Endeavoring to reshape the realms back to order.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of overcoming the chaos of the sundering and reestablishing peace and order. I've evaluated my expenses and %d gildar should suffice.
UnitType.Backstory: Idylla has dedicated her life to reconstruction and dreams of a future in which darkness won't prevail in the hearts of humankind. While she strives to act on a global level as befits an experienced mage, she will take time to mend broken crockery and sew stitches in a torn up doll.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'No one is so blind as the one who refuses to see.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life full of colors and laughter. Yes, I long for the times before the fracture. I'll fight to restore them and if you agree to the price of %d gildar, I'll fill your ranks.
UnitType.Backstory: Jorgo's eye affliction is mystical in nature, a gradual shift which will allow him to see into parallel planes of existence in the future. For now, he evolves in a world of black and white, longing to see colors again.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I didn't fall from Heaven, I shot for the highest star.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of designing new engines that will allow us to travel to the stars and beyond. I've got plenty of schematics but for now I have to toil on patching up my previous invention. Give me a decent dock err... workshop and I'll place you way ahead of the other pretenders in the tech race. %d gildar to help upgrade my workshop would also be nice.
UnitType.Backstory: Kodex Rapten doesn't seem to originate from this world, so alien is his speech, so avant-garde are his notions and ideas: improbable machines, voyages beyond the clouds into realms of freezing blackness with only the stars to guide the intrepid voyager. It would be easy to dismiss him as a scholar gone bonkers but there's enough content running around in his head that can be applied to the development of new technologies. Conceptual theories that you should siphon without a second thought, giving him free reign to play around with his new designs. After the arduous alpha and beta testings, you can rush what works to production and leave him to iron out the bugs and patch up what remains. Uh-oh he's got that gleam in his eyes again...

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Help me find acceptance, help find redemption.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of forgiveness, if such a word can be uttered by the likes of me. Please help me find redemption, let me join my path with yours and walk on the road to salvation. Show me your integrity and willingness to a forge a fair bond by accepting my price of %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: For committing unspeakable crimes, Lazareen has received the ultimate punishment of the Living Curse. Once a beautiful young woman, she's now broken in spirit and in body, shamefully hiding her disfigured face behind her helmet of darkness. No one knows exactly what she did to offend the gods so thoroughly but she took the full brunt of their vengeance. Some superstitious and concerned citizens whisper she's the Accursed One, whose coming was foretold in ancient scriptures, the One who will set in motion key events that will bring about the end of the world.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I can rescue your finances from the chasm of bankruptcy.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of becoming the richest lady in Elemental and building a financial empire. Let me be clear, I wouldn't enter politics and wouldn't be at cross purposes with you. I'm gifted with commerce and can keep your treasury flowing. For a modest fee of %d gildar plus wages.
UnitType.Backstory: The daughter of wealthy merchants, Legatha Sheldayne was raised to worship the gods of commerce. Picking up the family tradition, Legatha's imaginative negotiating techniques have doubled her parents' assets in a few short years. The sky being her limit, she hopes to acquire exclusive trading rights and become to sole supplier to thriving kingdoms, which would make her the richest woman in Elemental.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The snake will bite the hand that feeds it. At least you always know where you stand.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of ophidian rain dances. Hey you asked a personal question and I decided to reply with a nonsensical answer. Let's get to business here, want to recruit me? I ask for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: When Maran became known as "The Snake", it was not an insult but praise for her fighting techniques and graceful poise. She's agile and slippery as a serpent and knows how to manipulate potent poisons.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The trees are angry and I am the instrument of their vengeance.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of preserving the forests of Elemental from the ravages of war. That is my mission and the sole reason for my temporary existence. The Empires have committed unpardonable crimes by setting fires in the heart of our sacred forests. We will strike back and we know we can form an mutually beneficial alliance with your forces. To show your good faith in helping our cause and for lending our services, we will ask for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: The entity who goes by the name of Nereya Oakenknot is truly the spirit of a great oak given human form. Infuriated by the Empire tactics of burning down forests to flush Tarthans out of their hideouts, the trees have decided to get involved and fight back. A wooden simulacrum was shaped from several donors who sacrificed limbs and foliage. The most venerable of oaks then infused a fraction of his essence to animate their envoy. Thus was born Nereya Oakenknot, emissary of the trees.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Training troops cannot be done by taking shortcuts. You'll have to travel the roads of sacrifice, severity and discipline.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of being promoted to the lead the greatest army in Elemental. One should be straightforward with his ambitions and I am being honest. Hire me and I will make sure that your army will be THAT army. My fees: %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Little did Riemmil's father suspect that while his son was supposedly learning to master his knowledge in fire magic, he was skipping classes and attending military school. An average trainee when it came to hack and slash, the brass noticed him for his rising popularity among his classmates who had elected him as their de facto leader. Selected for officer training, Riemmil graduated with honors at the head of his promotion, making his bewildered father so proud that he was willing to forget a year full of lies and deceit.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'It only takes a dying ember to burn a city down.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of mastering the great blazes and the small hearth fires. I'm burning to... burn. I would keep your campfires alive for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: A pyromancer of great power, Sheavynn is well acquainted with several Fire Elementals, Burning Wraiths and many other denizens of the flames. Some whisper that her name isn't unknown to Delin, the Pyre of Man.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Tee hee...'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of tee hee... having the Darklings become the primary faction and rule Elemental for sure. Tee hee... Not very realistic you say? Well what we lack in finesse, we more than make up for it in craftiness. And numbers. Where did my accent go you ask? It must have fled along with my mistrust. I could envision a mutually beneficial alliance: my magic to aid you during battles in exchange for access to your scientific projects. %d gildar would kick-start our collaboration.
UnitType.Backstory: Although he loves to play the part of the scurrying, fearful and easily underestimated Darkling, Sodicus is in reality an incredibly gifted wizard capable of great feats of magic. Highly intelligent, he is viewed as a demigod by his people, the Shaman of shamans. Curious by nature, he is completely at ease mingling with the larger races and frequently trades for odds and ends with them. Although those instances are rare, he can even drop his Darkling antics and speak the common language unaccented if he decides to give his trust to someone. His unusual size for a Darkling could either be the result of a human or fallen ancestor (though anyone would balk at the idea of such interspecies breeding) or perhaps a blatant misuse of growth potions.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My nest is full of glimmering eggs.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of pilfering shiny things. Yes indeed there's a modicum of truth to my name, heh heh. If you wish to work with me, I will require %d gildar. Nice ring by the way...
UnitType.Backstory: Taggy is probably a kleptomaniac, incapable of resisting the lure of shiny items, whether precious artifacts or useless trinkets. An extremely talented thief, she's never been caught red handed to this day.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The voice of dissent is the one with the most impact and you should always pay serious attention to its words.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of silence and meditation spent on my hill. Human interaction is great, don't get me wrong, but disagreeing with everyone can have its downsides and I need lots of time alone to compensate. But the war is here and you need me. I wouldn't disagree with the price of %d gildar if you'd care to recruit me and my contradictions.
UnitType.Backstory: Talix Lonehill is a doubter, constantly second guessing and playing the devil's avocate. Is it because she spent so much time living as a recluse on top of her hill? An accomplished hunter with the spear, Talix has many other strengths to offer than her dissenting opinions.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Anyone using the word mongrel in my presence will find how easily I can break teeth.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of finding balance to the constantly warring sides of my heritage. While my mixed blood doesn't help me get friends, it certainly makes me a superior fighter. I know you need me right now and for %d gildar, I'll strengthen your army.
UnitType.Backstory: Urzeus is the illegitimate son of a Trog male and a Mancer female, a hybrid born to hatred and rejection, forcing his mother to flee the wrath of her native village barely an hour after his birth. After finding reluctant acceptance within a Tarthan settlement, Urzeus' mother raised her temperamental son as best she could, failing to suppress his violent Trog personality. Urzeus was incorporated into his village's militia, acquiring martial experience, until he yearned to discover the other side of valley.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'New sources of power for the next generation.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of expanding the known sources of power: magical, mental and spiritual. For a mere %d gildar, I shall be the healer and the mana well of your kingdom.
UnitType.Backstory: Although cool and aloof with his placid airs of quiet competence, Zem's permanent quest for new sources of power can drive him to childlike emotional outbursts. Zem is a veritable well of magical energies, directly tapping into essence nodes.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'To serve, to defend and to nurture.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of helping my fellow soldiers achieve their full potential. I would help yours for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Zhavia is a well respected soldier who has never received any demerits. Having lived through a difficult childhood as an orphan, her maternal instincts are always kicking in and she will provide support in one's hour of need. Morale is always positive whenever she's around.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The many secrets I have to whisper will be for the benefit of your sole ears. Even if you're missing one or two.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of ruling all administrative levels from the shadows. To gather secrets from dark corridors and weave them into a tapestry of counter-intrigue. Nothing escapes my eyes, nothing can hide from my vigilance and for %d gildar, every detail will belong to you.
UnitType.Backstory: A mysterious and alluring woman, Anuura is the shadow mistress who stands in the wings, the chamberlain always ready to act with dreadful efficiency at the slightest hint of trouble and unrest. Rarely seen and rarely heard, she works under cover of darkness, sees everything and watches everyone. Even in the deepest and lowest administrative levels, her hovering presence can be felt, to the point of being often imagined, boosting productivity and keeping dissension at bay. Her counsels are whispered directly in the ear of her liege, to the dismay of the court whose members tremble at the mere thought of being included in the day's report. Which brings up a legitimate question: who watches the powerful administrative overseer? Who keeps the balance? You can always ask Anuura.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Woof.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of running with the pack and chasing prey to exhaustion before going for the kill. Your pack lacks fur but for %d gildar, I would be willing to overlook that glaring flaw.
UnitType.Backstory: Ever since he's been bitten by a rabid Warg, Barkus hasn't been feeling too well. He tends to foam at the mouth and to fight dogs for stray bits of raw meat.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Constant anger will lead you to perform astonishing feats on the battlefield.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of reaching that point of total bliss on the battlefield when your anger drives you to accomplish the impossible. Best I use that wrath for you than against eh? %d gildar would be enough and let the rage explode. Just watch out for the shrapnel.
UnitType.Backstory: Bullda has been angry all her life, she's never been able to calm down. She's learned to use that inextinguishable wrath as a focus and her formidable rage has mowed down entire squads of enemies in the heat of battle.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Rock or bone, I grind it all with a mere thumb.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of hearing the sweet music of my enemies' bones breaking apart. I'd set up shop with you and yours for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Daymo Shatterbone is a cruel brute and his bloody streak has always been the pride of his family clan. Breaking bones has become a true hobby and he seeks to fine-tune those gruesome cracking sounds to perfection.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Go on challenge me, I dare you.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of dominating physically and magically anyone foolish enough to defy me. It's a calling. For %d gildar, your projects would benefit from my contributions.
UnitType.Backstory: Harrutti prides herself on both her intellectual and physical prowess. She is perpetually competing and can be a tiresome companion, inventing the most insignificant challenges to prove her worth.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I have nothing left to share but hatred.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of complete destruction. My private vendetta came to a successful end and yet this burning hatred is still festering within. Let's agree to %d gildar for my services and I'll wither your enemies back to their ancestors.
UnitType.Backstory: The day Jemalia found out her lover had scorned her is one that shook the very foundations of the Kraxis Empire. Her hatred buoying her, she cast spells of destruction that obliterated the traitor along with his newfound paramour. She then attacked their families and friends. When the palace mages finally intervened to stop the bloodbath, it was far too late. Jemalia had long since vanished.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The power of the Void is all encompassing.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of absolute darkness, the complete absence of light. For %d gildar, I'll bring the forces of the night to your side.
UnitType.Backstory: Jet Lightbane's past is a complete blank, no one knows where he comes from or even if he's a genuine individual and not some random shadow's anomalous physical manifestation.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Adversity is like a taming a Warboar. After kicking it around a few times, it no longer tries to bite you.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of human settlements put to the torch, screaming orphans and a tons of loot. Hahaha, don't worry I'm not that shallow but you get the gist. Now let's not waste any more time and start conquering and plundering! An advance on those future spoils would be welcome: %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Kadarom Rumble loves playing the part of the true barbarian even though he's intelligent and educated. Warfare brings him such a rush that he's more than happy to drop the mask of civilization and free the beast inside so he can hurl himself thoughtlessly into the fray. Once he surfaces from his berserker episodes, he usually scoffs at the consequences of his very destructive and tragic actions.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The present is nothing but a retelling of the past.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of poetry and songs which lift the spirit and speak to the heart. Ancient knowledge is hidden in the old ballads and I will sing them to you. My repertoire is considerate and for %d gildar, you will get to listen to all of it.
UnitType.Backstory: Armed with nothing but her sweet voice and wooden lute, Lyria is a talented songstress capable of entrancing the most difficult audiences. She is a veritable vault of knowledge despite having no formal academic training, to the utter despair of many scholars who would love to dismiss her as nothing more than a tavern troubadour.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'It's not because I can heal that I embrace Kingdom ideals.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of... what does it matter to you? You want to hire me, just say so and stop beating around the bush. You can also hand out %d gildar, no bartering, negotiating, haggling, just hand it out.
UnitType.Backstory: Odena would claim she is first and foremost a warrior. She is far better known as a healer however, constantly called upon to treat serious and superficial injuries given the rarity of this talent in Empire armies. Her bedside manners are so horrible that she's been nicknamed Odious Odena. She will yell at barely conscious patients, berating them for their clumsiness and incompetence, blaming them for their wounds and for bleeding all over the place.
