She will nevertheless always get the job done and sometimes, very rarely, a kind gesture will manage to creep through the barrage of abuse.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in
Enemies that strike this unit become infected

UnitType.Quote: 'I come in the wake of my siblings Famine and War to put the final touches to their tapestry of destruction.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of sicknesses, diseases and plagues. Serving as an agent of Death is my ultimate regalement, how blissful to see entire communities wilt after my passing. Your struggles against those upstarts could help me further my own agenda. Yes, I will carry the plague to your enemies for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: The entity calling himself Pestilence probably originates from the Asag. A disease carrier, he limps from settlement to settlement, infecting and destroying communities already greatly weakened by isolation and the havoc brought by the Cataclysm. Pestilence doesn't seem to have any aims or desires beyond spreading plagues and being an agent of destruction. Surrounded by a cloud of affliction, constantly oozing pus, he is so toxic that anyone touching him automatically becomes infected.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The Great Cleaver who doesn't holler "timber" for trees but for chopped down adversaries.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of eternal summers and well... swinging my axe around too. For %d gildar, I'll fell your enemies and stack them like cords of woods.
UnitType.Backstory: Rendarr's "in your face" attitude while wielding his giant axe has earned him a certain amount of respect. He loves to scream "timber" at the top of his lungs whenever he strikes down an opponent.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Swift and resilient, the ultimate combination.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of overcoming my opponents with the perfect blend of attack and defense. %d gildar would insure my loyalty to your cause.
UnitType.Backstory: Sangham The Lithe is said to have the potential to become the best fighter of his generation. An accomplished wrestler, he knows how to put on a show during tournaments.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The artful dodger.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of never being hit again. Ever. I'll do the hitting from now on. And I would produce those blows for %d gildar, if you care to have me by your side.
UnitType.Backstory: Shegdath Zaristan became an "artful dodger" at the school of hard knocks when she started avoiding her abusive parents' punches and kicks. Her fear of painful retribution morphed into a dodging ability of precognitive nature, anticipating blows before they come.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I am the dirge that foretells the passing of your enemies.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for an absence of life while finishing my masterpiece titled... Ode to... to... Life. Yes, that's it. I am the best composer, musician and singer in Elemental. World famous, the darling of all music aficionados. I could sing for you but art requires financing and I would demand %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Sonata Invideus was a world class singer and musician in pre-Cataclysm times. She had composed a huge body of songs and just as she was putting the final touches to her masterpiece "Ode to Life", she was killed in the tragic events of the Cataclysm. Refusing to relinquish her hold on this world until her song was finished and perfected, Sonata clawed her way out of her grave. Only the person who came out was a twisted and hateful creature, the shell of a corpse animated by a vengeful spirit. Joy gave way to madness and her once beautiful ode wilted into a dirge of utter despair, a heartrending testimony to the end of the world.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'We're fighting an uphill battle and the slopes are getting steeper.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life that any commander worth his grain of salt would want. Respect from the troops for a job well done, for being fair and for being the best commander they've had the privilege to serve with. Let's work together, let's shape your armies for the hard battles to come. I will work for you for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Systelle Desovac has got the voice to back her commands, convincing recalcitrants on the spot to give their best and revitalizing army morale with incredible motivational speeches. Who would believe that behind this fortress of assertiveness on the battlefield lies a terminally shy woman when it comes to private matters?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Knowledge is more than just power, it's the path to victory.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of scholarly pursuits and intellectual illumination. For %d gildar, I'd let you consult my thesis and private arcane tomes of knowledge.
UnitType.Backstory: Xuno has earned his "Errant" nickname for being kicked out of every place of learning he has visited. You see, he tends to deteriorate works he disagrees with.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Modern applications to ancient magical sciences.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of ancient incantations whispered in black towers. Yes I agree, it's probably a tired trope but us evil wizards have got to keep up appearances. Anyway, my collaboration isn't cheap: %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Zurykar is a cantankerous Mage always up to some mischief, constantly busy with multiple disreputable projects going on simultaneously. Extremely curious, he's found himself in dire straits more than once, making enemies out of the wrong people.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Who goes there? No one shall pass without my leave.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of testing my mettle against others' metal. Yeah I know, tired ol' joke. I just love the sound of steel hitting on steel, when you realize there is no room for error, that this is it. Your army doesn't look too shabby. For %d gildar, I could change it from acceptable to magnificent.
UnitType.Backstory: Cravius Murmillo claims to be an elite warrior who knows all the feints and parries, who can hit opponents to devastating effects with a mere swing of his lance. He's brash and arrogant but there's great loyalty hiding behind those brazen words.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The wisdom of the universe speaks from the glare of the stars.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of becoming one with the stars up above. To become part of the constellations and converse with Lady Moon... Yes? Joining you? I would only tear myself away from my star gazing for the sum of %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Ever since his life-changing accident during which a mystical stellar fragment collided directly with his soul, Felgam has been looking to the heavens, longing to join the stars in their eternal dance.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Administrating can be compared to conducting a musical orchestra. You need a maestro to turn the cacophony and discordance into something beautiful.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of scholarly research and I burn to unearth the knowledge that was lost during the Cataclysm. Oh and I know how to appease spirits in an official capacity. For %d gildar, I shall give your kingdom the efficiency it deserves.
UnitType.Backstory: Fyrell is the fifth son of a prominent chamberlain and was raised with noble and royal progeny, thus acquiring the manners and ideals of the future elite. A versatile scholar, Fyrell dabs in just about every subject and has written several academic treatises, cataloguing his experiments and research. Administration is where he excels however, stepping out of his father's large shadow and into his own sun of competence.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Let's dance one more time.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of peace and quiet... Too many wars... And yet I can't deny craving for the sweet music of whirling blades. I suppose I could do the swords dance one more... Let's agree to %d gildar and my lethal blade is yours.
UnitType.Backstory: Gladius Duceus has participated in countless wars and while he says he deserves an idle retirement, the constant pull of adventure keeps him away from the quiet life he strives for.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My knowledge is a furrow. A furrow as deep as the other side of the world.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of vibrating along with tectonic movements and continental shifts. This land needs to be healed and I sense you could be The One. Let us join forces and for %d gildar, I will put the quake in the heart of your enemies.
UnitType.Backstory: A geomancer of the first order, Grenda Kazm has journeyed to the center of the world and sailed on seas of molten lava. She visited the fabled Gemstone Caverns and was granted an audience by the Council of Earthen Elementals which somehow deigned to address a mortal. Resurfacing to find her beloved country torn by bitter wars, Grenda felt she had to get involved and tip the scales. She seeks the fabled leader who will reunite the realms under one banner, the very one the Earthen Council alluded to.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I will lead our legions to the heart of the battle and the minstrels will sing of our victory for generations to come.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of just acknowledgement. Not for my personal glory but a just reward is when a ruler will take stock of a given situation and validate efforts and sacrifices. Yes I'm a bitter old man but I still have it in me to lead your armies to their ultimate triumph. My experience is at your service for %d gildar plus wages.
UnitType.Backstory: An illustrious general, Jonstone Sepharius led the sortie at Crooked Castle and broke the bloody Fallen siege which had lasted over two months. Scared of Jonstone's rising popularity, cowardly King Varl IV relegated him to barracks duty at the worst possible moment. Realizing the only solution to stop the downward spiral of bad decisions and win the war would be to depose the King, Jonstone refused such extremities and escaped from Crooked Castle under the cover of the night, leaving his beloved country like a thief. He now seeks revenge on fate and demands a second chance. Will you be able to give him that chance?

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Welcome to my little shop of scalding steam. Please wipe your feet at the entrance.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of bridging my dual and contradictory sides. Water and Fire don't mix too well you see and sometimes the dichotomy fractures my mind and soul. But these opposite forces are tremendously powerful and if you wish for them to work for you, it will cost you %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Equally entranced by the disciplines of Fire and Water magic, Leranthe refused to make a choice and studied both assiduously. She might have sacrificed her peace of mind as a result of the innate contradictions but she certainly gained a unique perspective.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'To fly like an eagle.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of flying to the heavens with the Air Elementals. I'll get there someday. In the meantime, I would be willing to focus on some more worldly pursuits such as helping you out a bit. I would only ask for the just sum of %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Lurna Hestian is a dreamer who longs to fly and frolic with the denizens of the skies. She has acquired considerable knowledge in Air Magic and she just might end up breaking the clouds to reach the rainbow's end.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I'm the concrete proof that chivalry is vibrant and alive.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of reviving the true art of chivalry in these barbaric times. A warning to you: my blade has a conscience and I will fight for you only if you don't stray from the true path. I believe %d gildar would be a fair price to start our collaboration.
UnitType.Backstory: Known as the Sapphire Knight, Orwen Corundum is truly the ladies' darling, the bold and dashing warrior representing all the romantic aspects of chivalry. Fighting only for righteous causes, Orwen is extremely demanding of himself, animated by unrelenting discipline and strict moral codes.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I can mend frayed life threads and deny passage into oblivion.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of keeping the flames that animate us alive and whole. By "us" I mean all living beings, whether plants, animals or humans. It's a calling I can't deny. You need healing, your army needs it too and for %d gildar, I will mend those broken bones.
UnitType.Backstory: A healer of extraordinary talent, Osteen Okuvar has been the object of a bidding war between rival sovereigns who wished to recuit her. Amused by the entire affair, Osteen refused both offers and left to wage her own personal war against rampant sickness and suffering. Even though she would never admit it and she hides it well, Osteen receives a portion of the person's pain as vicious feedback whenever she repairs damaged tissue. Thankfully, she also feels the relief flooding her patient and thrives on the reward of pushing back the dark curtains of ruin.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'It's only when the odds are desperately stacked against you that you can truly prove your worth.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of finding myself in insane situations which require giving everything I have to come out on top. I know you're headed in such danger and for %d gildar, I'll be there for you.
UnitType.Backstory: A child of desert nomads, Panurga Lenax illustrated herself when she was hired to escort a Capitar caravan through dangerous territories claimed by the Syndicate. While passing through a bottleneck, the caravan was ambushed by an army of brigands. As her fellow mercenaries were struck down by the first assault, Panurga repelled wave after wave of attackers, felling them with vicious sweeps of her axe. Achieving a complete state of focus, she pushed her battered body well beyond its natural limits. Unable to strike down this fury, the remaining handful of bandits wisely took the better part of valor and retreated to lick their wounds. Richly rewarded by the grateful merchants, Panugra spent everything to upgrade her equipment and immediately looked for a new employer.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'An eagle eye for a bull's-eye.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of founding my own college which would teach the noble discipline of archery, what else?. I need a partner for that. I've been following your exploit and I could work for you. My wages wouldn't stop your cashflow, a mere %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: A former archery dilettante, Radiann began to train seriously when the fever to hit the target struck her unexpectantly. In a few short months, she surpassed her befuddled instructors and realized they had nothing left to teach her. She's currently lobbying high powered individuals to fund the construction of her Archery College.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'There are unsuspected forces only waiting to be called upon if you can feel them beyond the veil.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of being summoned myself. The thrill of summoning is horribly addicting and I need to find out what it's like to be the recipient of such a spell. In the meantime, I will materialize a host of allies to aid in your struggles: for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Suvelda Soudyah is a summoner who has acquired a certain renown in wizardly circles, envied for her mastery and ease in summoning creatures from the elemental realms. Her talents do seem to have side-effects as she is frequently found speaking to herself, engaged in deep conversations with invisible partners.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Absolute zero is my comfort zone.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of eternal winters and scorching blizzards. Feeling cold already? Think about what I could do to your enemies. %d gildar and I'll put them on ice.
UnitType.Backstory: Thurmava is a Frostborn hailing from the fabled Realms of Perpetual Winters, an ice queen of the Frozen Deep. She's just passing through these sweltering lands where Vetrar is still believed to dwell. Just before departing on her mysterious quest, the fabled Winter Mace was entrusted to her care with the strong reminder that should she ever set the weapon down in the Lands of the Sun, she would melt away to nothing.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'My steel may no longer shine but my sword remains sharp.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of... Well I've lived it all! I've been around for so long you could probably say I've lived a thousand lives. For %d gildar, I'd accept to go at it one more time.
UnitType.Backstory: Sir Vermund is a legendary character, the veteran of a thousand wars, the ruler of several forgotten kingdoms. Some scholars argue that he's been cursed with immortality and will keep appearing on battlefields until there are no more wars to be fought.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Prolonged suffering is not the way to go. Clean and quick are the requisites to achieve the perfect assassination.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of... Sorry I just don't care to divulge anything private. I believe my reputation precedes me and if you wish to see me in action, you'll have to hand me %d gildar up front.
UnitType.Backstory: Vivacia Varlotta is a famous hitwoman who's worked for several sovereigns, removing enemies and troublemakers with quiet efficiency. She's well versed in poisons and knows many antidote formulas by rote.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Only a few steps left to absolute power.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of discovering the secrets of immortality so I can achieve my full potential. Too much to do, so little time. I'm in desperate need of funds and would join your skirmishes for %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Alikar is one of the fabled Archmagi, capable of casting intricate spells at incredible speed. He believes he has the potential to rival the Titans' power. His ego is probably already there.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I eat mages for supper.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life set in firm reality. Those wizards and mages, they're not natural, they're perversions. What's that? Sure I could help you... I guess I could tolerate those mages in your army just as long as they keep away from me. I would ask for %d gildar to sweeten the pot though.
UnitType.Backstory: Magic slides off Bruffus Thorrigan's back like water off the feathers of a duck. He's a much sought-after mercenary as his presence provides relief and security whenever spells start blasting overhead.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I'm still waiting for them to design a pitchfork so I can complete my gear.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of corrupting the innocent and flaming pyres. Mwa ha ha, you expected that didn't you? If you'd like my burning personality to aid your cause, you'll have to fork (get it?) up %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Desdevar Eblis is the son of a Kraxis woman and an unidentified demon. His mother never could elaborate on his father's whereabouts as her sanity snapped while giving birth to her demonic child. Raised in secrecy by a fearful aunt, Desdevar reached adulthood in only a few short years. Feeling the pull of his demonic heritage, he vanished one day leaving behind him a raging fire which destroyed an entire city block.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I bash heads and crack skulls for gildar. Let us speak of wages before anything else.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of empowerment and my "little" axe provides that for me. You hiring? I could reduce bones to powder for you if you meet my conditions: %d gildar and don't even try to bargain, I will refuse anything less.
UnitType.Backstory: A violent nature, Drussilla beat her husband to a pulp with a domestic hammer when he refused to get out of bed one morning. Enlisting in the local militia, she quickly rose through the ranks, bullying and hazing along the way. The now formidable soldier turned mercenary seeks an employer, no morals needed, just as long as there is a sizable sack of gildar at the end of the day.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I'd rather shoot heads than apples.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of perfect precision. Talking about archery here, I'm the best there is and that's a fact. I'll make you a bargain, for %d gildar I'm going to put my quiver at your service.
UnitType.Backstory: When her parents never came back one harrowing night, it fell on Honnra's young shoulders to feed her siblings. Picking up her ma's old bow, something clicked deep within her and she knew that old piece of wood was an extension of herself. An exceptional archer, Honnra's skills border on the supernatural.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The only way is the forceful way.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of everything after being denied my very own name. You see this maul? I crushed my father with it. It could crush your enemies too if you have enough coin, say %d gildar, to hire me.
UnitType.Backstory: Denied her name for being the bastard child of a clan chieftain, Kragga came back to her village to confront her father upon reaching adolescence. He laughed in her face and mocked her as the product of a stray lewd thought. Her response was to cave his skull in with her huge maul. She then claimed his name "Kruxen" for herself and burned his hut. With a semblance of closure, she now seeks to find her place in the world.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Maybe I haven't reached the status of the legendary heroes just yet but I'm certainly no fallen enchantress.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of flying and burrowing, to reunite the seeming contradictions into a perfect whole. I realize it sounds a bit esoteric but other magical practitioners should have an inkling of what I'm talking about. Yes, I could work for you for %d gildar. Let's become legendary heroes together!
UnitType.Backstory: Lougana has intuitive knowledge of ley lines and weather patterns, feels the earthworm tunneling its galleries and the bird soaring on air currents, has her feet firmly planted on the ground while her head is in the clouds. Her grasp of these fundamentals make her a formidable sorceress whose magical flow is in perfect harmony with the elements she commands.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I come to you as the Daughter of the Deep Sea. Let us crest the raging waves together.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of battering waves and pulling tides. The sound of the sea always within reach. Your cause intrigues me and I would consider adding my powers to strengthen its claim. I would ask for %d gildar to allow it to happen.
UnitType.Backstory: Oceana Ichtyone's origins are shrouded in mysteries of legendary proportions. She is said to be a daughter of the ocean, stepping out of the waves in full regalia, with glistening bright green seaweed for hair. She is revered as a minor divinity by some Quendar factions.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I will be your eyes and your voice across infinite distances as we communicate through our symbiotic link.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of linking my mind to one of the champions of legend. I know you are one of the Chosen and I would be honored to serve you. I would only respectfully ask for my expenses to be covered, about %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: The personage known as Quibben Cerebrax is always mentioned in hushed tones for fear that he can hear anything being discussed about him. Claiming to be a telepath, Quibben wishes to establish a mental bond with one of the great leaders of Elemental and position himself as a key player while the political board is being remodeled.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'If it pumps blood, I'll know how to sever it.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of achieving the most intricate and subtle assassinations. Such as killing sovereigns who think their legions afford them protection and safety from my bloody reach. This is the challenge I live for! Might as well do it for you... For %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Rashetti is one of those assassins who thinks so highly of himself that his ego could probably fill an ocean or two. Unfortunately for his potential targets, he's not completely deluded and truly is a formidable "veinfinder".

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Sometimes love comes through excruciating pain. I know the sun loves me.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life in the sun, basking in the glory of its rays. Yes you'd probably think my complexion's a bit cooked and I should go sit in the shade for a long while. You know nothing. That doesn't mean I wouldn't consider joining your angry band. %d gildar would do it.
UnitType.Backstory: A war prisoner abandoned in the middle of the desert, Raspelle's sensitive Wraith skin was irremediably scorched by the unrelenting sun. She was rescued by a caravan of nomads who nursed her back to health to the best of their abilities. While her skin remains raw and irrevocably bright pink, she acquired a strange bond with the sun and is now capable of withstanding the most intense fires.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I will write sweet billets and sooth the minds of your thriving Empire.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of writing the cleverest billets in Elemental. Ha! You think I'm being ironic? You either love your job or you don't. Well seeing as my skills aren't exactly commonplace on the recruitment square, I will ask for %d gildar to enter your service.
UnitType.Backstory: An administrative genius, Shamrah Greenstone knows how to pen a written order and motivate her charges, from the rank and file to the highest dignitary. She also helps scientists and scholars, often encouraging them to explore avenues they might have prematurely disregarded.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The races of men are an evolutionary impasse and must be eradicated like the cowardly vermin they are.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of taking the Cataclysm to the next logical step which is the utter destruction of the human races. For %d gildar, I shall begin cleaning Elemental of the infestations.
UnitType.Backstory: Tarrask Sorgard is the Trogs' nightmarish version of a knight, all clad in black armor which seems to drain light and convert it into cold despair. Survivors of raids led by Tarrask Sorgard speak of a descending apostle of death who delivers freezing destruction in complete silence, killing soldiers and defenseless civilians alike without mercy.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Don't pick that other weakling groveling before you. I'll flatten that grinning face as soon as we make a deal together.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of affirming my superiority through deeds of strength. You see, I'm stronger than an Ogre and could easily snap you in two with a single hand if I so wished. For %d gildar, we could forge an alliance.
UnitType.Backstory: Verusko proved his extraordinary strength when he challenged a Young Ogre to a boulder throwing contest and won. He then quickly rose to the rank of war chieftain and considers himself a sovereign over the troops he commands. He has little patience and will hurl boulders at anyone who dares to offer a dissenting opinion.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Unlike sterile diplomatic talks, negotiating at knifepoint will never fail to bring the desired results.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of taking the reins of my own destiny and start making my own decisions. Yes you heard me right and maybe seeking employment isn't the best way to go... However, that's what I'll do for now until I get settled. So let's recap, for %d gildar I'll start assassinating.
UnitType.Backstory: The assassin known as Xallas Exaltan was given away at a very young age by her parents to the slaver known as Torqwhar in exchange for settling a hopeless debt. Amused by the young whelp's defiant attitude, Torqwhar decided to turn her into a deadly instrument of vengeance through rigorous training and brainwashing. Removing useless traits such as compassion and kindness, Xallas was sculpted and groomed to become a heartless assassin. Torqwhar was found dead one night in a sordid Hagudst back-alley, obviously bled dry from a thousand cuts, leading to speculation that his creation overcame her conditioning and dealt retribution in the most definite way.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The color of my skin is only a pale reflection of the places I've been and the things I've seen.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life that no longer exists. If only I could turn back time and be the young and innocent girl I used to be. Now I've seen too many things, things you could never fully understand. But enough of this, I now have great powers and for a position in your army and also %d gildar, I would fight at your side.
UnitType.Backstory: Ydriss' apprenticeship to the wizard Marelon was cut short when a magical experiment went terribly awry. A portal to the realms of Shadows was accidentally opened and a barrage of counterspells couldn't shut it down. The threat of alien invasion being imminent, Marelon panicked and pushed Ydriss through the portal, the desperate measure succeeding in sealing the aperture. Feeling little remorse over his actions, Marelon covered up his misdeeds by claiming his apprentice had never showed up for work that day and fired her in absentia. Only Ydriss reappeared out of thin air several months later, her skin the color of night and with vengeance in her heart. Summoning several elemental creatures, she ordered them to kill her former master and destroy his research. Now estranged from her former life, Ydriss interpreted the current global conflict as a chance to pick up the pieces and start over.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Gunko n' Gunji 'tack 'nemy herds n' bring t'you heads on stick!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: We thirst for a life of finding a new tribe and fighting alongside our new brothers and sisters, whether it is for new territories, loot or just to settle ancient grudges. Gunji and I will ride at the head of your armies and harass the front lines, leaving your troops all the necessary latitude to finish the job. Drawing first blood is actually a competitive thing between riders. We would strike a bargain for %d gildar, any less would be a sellout (transcribed from mangled common speech).
UnitType.Backstory: When Gunko failed to bring back his quota of sand worms, the village elder punished him by separating him from his War Boar Gunji. Refusing to accept such a cruel and arbitrary edict, Gunko waited for the sun to set and broke Gunji out of his paddock. Full of heartache at leaving their beloved tribe, Gunko and Gunji crossed the desert, a thousand leagues of treacherous dunes and crags under a searing sun. Attracted by the belligerent activities of the competing kingdoms and empires, Gunko decided to find a new tribe and offer his martial talents to a worthy lord, one who would give a veteran Wilding Rider his due respect.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I Hazawath. Ouch stick bambam for shinies. Gimme gimme?'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of pointy pointy ouch stick for shiny shinies. (He wants %d gildar, just so you know).
UnitType.Backstory: After witnessing countless battles during which his Darkling brethren were easily dispatched by weak opponents, Hazawath refused to take shortcuts and invested time in polishing his mastery over the spear. He also had a epiphany of sorts when he realized it was probably best to join those stronger opponents than fight against them. Like all Darklings, Hazawath loves "shinies" and would not hesitate to sell his entire village for half a coin.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The perks of being statuesque are many. I can just as easily lay waste to your enemies as decorate your gardens.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of fun and games and I'm so happy to have found such a good home inside this statue. Hey, let's give a good scare to that brooding champion over there! Eh? Oh well maybe later then? You want my help? Sure but this gorgeous statue requires maintenance and I will ask for %d gildar to make it shine once more.
UnitType.Backstory: A playful spirit inhabiting a rather diminutive Guardian Statue, Klayzon Verdigris loves to play pranks on the unwary. His work is cut out for him as many mistake him for real stonework until he whispers in their ear, taps on their shoulder or passes the salt during garden picnics. On the other hand, pigeons also confuse him with a real statue, their favorite perch, and he will flee in terror if a flock lands in his vicinity.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Now that Lobrubrah the magnificent is here, victory is but a formality.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of eating and being served while lying on a mountain of cushions. I'm the greatest Troll Shaman on this side of Elemental, on any side actually. For food being served every few hours, I will crush your enemies with a few chosen spells. (Such quantities of food would cost %d gildar).
UnitType.Backstory: Lobrubrah grew impatient when his Troll packmates didn't return to their lair with the usual loot and food. Tired of waiting on them and having eaten everything remotely edible in sight, Lobrubrah finally opted for moving his cumbersome carcass and searching for his missing acolytes. Only to find that a Clambercoil Dragon had used them as appetizers. Far too lazy to take care of himself, Lobrubrah decided to seek out the squishy races and offer to participate in their silly wars in exchange for six servings of food per day and comfortable lodgings.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Ayayaaah! Spear sharp! Teeth sharp! Ayayaaah!.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: We thirst for a life of plunging headfirst into enemy lines in a rush of speed. There is great pride in getting the first strike, it is the only true way to prove your courage and valor, to prove you deserve the name "warrior". For %d gildar we'll sweep your enemies off their feet, as easily as you could squash a Mite (transcribed from mangled common speech).
UnitType.Backstory: The Darkling Mogwadi and the Warg Dripfangs were born together, raised together and cannot be separated from one another. To do so would probably spell their end as they cannot function individually, so symbiotic is their relationship. Looking enviously at the escalating battles spreading across the land, they wish to join the fun and ride headlong into the fray, thrilling in the glory of inflicting the first strike.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'This here pointies spitter isn't for shooting mice.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of shooting and looting. Nothing else interests me. I'll join your clan for %d gildar, you know, I'm talking about those shinies.
UnitType.Backstory: Ragwort's horizons suddenly brightened when the spoils of war handed him his beloved crossbow. He ditched his crude shortbow in a ravine and crowed his superiority over his Darkling brethren. Universally hated, the despicable rat was eventually kicked out of his village and left to fend for himself. A true scavenger, he seeks an employer who will let him shoot his marvelous weapon from the sidelines and pillage the battlefield once the dust settles down.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: '[Silence greets you].'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: [Silence greets you]. It's probably best to just deposit %d gildar at the golem's feet and see what happens.
UnitType.Backstory: The name Cerulnos Stoneheart appears in the most ancient scriptures recounting extraordinary battles that changed the face of the world. It is said that in times of great need, Cerulnos Stoneheart will appear to offer his aid to the most deserving of champions. Some scholars argue that the construct is animated by the spirit of an ancient hero who refuses to relinquish his hold on the mortal plane.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'The essssenssse ssspeaksss to me and I sssenssse that exssseptional ssstirringzzz are afoot. Allow an ssserpent prinsssesss to lend her assssissstanssse.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirssst for a life of ssspawning ssserveral Ophidian pitsss. I come to cooperate in exssschange for land which would ssserve as rezzzervezzz for ssserpentsss, sssafe havenzzz onssse the warzzz are over. I have no ussse for metal but you mussst pay the prissse anyway: %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: Sssthsss is an Ophidian princess who serves as an ambassador for the Serpent Kingdoms, with plenipotentiary powers to negotiate treaties. In exchange for her help, the Serpents will claim territories which will serve as future reserves from the encroachment of Men. That and maybe less snakes in the grass.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'You won't need your blacksmiths anymore and may convert them into soldiers or use them as fuel for the furnaces, whichever suits best.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of inventing the perfect alloy and if you supply the metal for my experiments, I would craft weapons for your temporal needs. Installing my workshop will cost %d gildar.
UnitType.Backstory: The origins of the entity calling itself the Flaming Forgeron are unknown but they obviously largely predate the Cataclysm. Permanently wrapped in a mantle of intense fire, the Forgeron soften metals itself, serving as both forge and blacksmith. It is constantly toiling, experimenting and refining all the while dreaming of discovering the perfect indestructible alloy.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Great power can be harvested from great conflagrations.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of rising in the demon hierarchy and ruling my own portion of the Hellfire realms. I'm here to gather power to accomplish such a coup and I will demand %d gildar for the privilege of having a future infernal celebrity in your midst.
UnitType.Backstory: Vaglutta is a greater Assassin Demon who sees the current extraordinary shifts in the mortal realms as opportunities to amass knowledge and power in order to gain the upper hand against his infernal competitors. An unreliable ally at best, he is nonetheless a formidable assassin.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I like Trogs! Their skulls sharpen my axes and their flesh sits well in my belly. Hyuk hyuk!'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of chopping, crushing, dicing, pulverizing, tearing apart every single Trog that still walks this land. My freedom comes with a price, the price of vengeance, the price of torrents of blood and guts! Treat me right and I will charge into the fray and fell them ALL!! (keeping this brute around will cost you %d gildar in upkeep for damaged property, broken equipment, various healing bills...).
UnitType.Backstory: Escaped Juggernauts are not exactly a sight unseen: you can meet a few occasionally here and there attempting to claim some territory and trying to make something of their unnatural selves. Some even roam around aimlessly carrying swords that would befit a Titan. You'll be hard pressed however to find one who would turn hatred for his former masters into something productive and vengefully sell himself out to the other side. Vorass Spinebender is such a Juggernaut, allying reckless strength with the mind of a child, breaking his gruesome toys with such abandon that he's capable of crushing his teammates during his temper tantrums. Be prepared to duck if you remove his leash. Multiple times.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Let us howl the sweet melody of oblivion and push this dying world into restful nothingness.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of gathering all available shadows and weaving them into a tapestry of nothingness. To what purpose? Why for art's sake, art to obscure and ultimately destroy this world of light and life. Yes I believe, strange as it may seem, that we may come to an understanding. I will require several accommodations (which will cost about %d gildar) however and our pack can be formed.
UnitType.Backstory: Tenebres Voidsinger is a Shadow Warg who has overstayed his welcome into the material plane. Refusing to be dismissed like a vulgar servant, he barked a vicious counterspell and disintegrated the foolhardy mage who had dared to summon him. Now completely autonomous and free to explore his adoptive dimension without a mystical leash, Tenebres has vowed to turn Elemental into a cold and barren shadow world in which only lifeless spirits and entities of demonic persuasion can survive. Obviously, only an alliance of a temporary nature can be stricken with this canine of the void.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I weave the material for the outfit of your doom.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of weaving the immense web of the underworld and catching angels in my sticky strands. For %d gildar, I'll trap those sovereign flies that keep buzzing around your lands in my web and eat them for supper.
UnitType.Backstory: A minor spider deity, Mhoorsh's power was severely drained by the band of sick ritualists who sought to drink up her essence. She hates being indebted to you for saving her and while she is mystically bound to aid you, she is already fighting against her spiritual shackles. Watch your back lest you become her next meal.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'Try being funny and I'll carve you another smile, a bloody one.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of ending petty scheming and doing things on a grand scale. For %d gildar, I'll gladly open my... horizons and join you.
UnitType.Backstory: While Jolly Molly would deny until voiceless that she's spent several years working in brothels, rumors remain persistent. She's well-connected with several thieves guilds and knows a host of unsavory characters on a personal level. Her mishap with the Banshees has mellowed her much and she's truly grateful for the rescue. Even if she still remains partially in the spiritual plane and exists now on both sides.

GameModifier.Provides: -5% Unrest in the city this unit is in

UnitType.Quote: 'I'll huff and I'll puff and blow those walls down like so many strands of hay.'
UnitType.NPCRecruitmentText: I thirst for a life of violent tempests and soft breezes. The rest is not something a mortal could possibly grasp. I can lend a helping wind for %d gildar. I have no use for it but I like the pretty colors.
UnitType.Backstory: A Crow Demon showing an interest in mortal affairs is indeed quaint. Curious to a fault, Rhol Shushah - Rhol being the equivalent of Sir/Lady - has always secretly spied on the frail denizens walking the earth and even occasionally intervened directly by lending a helping wind. Until he was caught by his elders and punished for transgressing their edicts which strictly forbid such interactions.

Old texts, the kind so hard to decipher that divergent interpretations crop up all too quickly, mention the Amethyst Automaton. It appears to be an ancient guardian whose charge has been lost to the sands of time, making it drift without purpose for centuries. What is clearly written is that the Amethyst Automaton was responsible for the destruction of the Empire of Landolas, single-handedly crushing its mighty armies and laying waste to its refined cities. Is history going to repeat itself? Made entirely of magically reinforced amethyst, the Automaton can blind the unwary when its crystalline frame refracts light, leaving them helpless to defend themselves against its huge and deadly greatsword.

Yellowbelly was originally a Coastal Skath until the mad sorcerer Kavaduz performed some gruesome magical experiments upon it. Attempting to create an invincible familiar, he altered the Skath with draconic and serpentine genes. Kavaduz wasn't expecting to succeed so soon and paid the ultimate price for his stroke of genius. Yellowbelly smashed its cage apart, swallowed its tormentor in a single gulp and gained freedom. Driven by an insatiable hunger, it requires constant sustenance and will attack anything in sight. Make no mistake about it, Yellowbelly is no coward as its name might imply. Defeating this mad Skath could prove rewarding for who knows what treasures might lie in its stomach?
